Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityAlex
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home after five nights at the Residence Inn and I am happy to recommend it to you. The staff is great - including the people that worked the breakfast room. They were always busy but didn't hesitate with a pleasant "good morning" and a smile. And breakfast was excellent. Wide variety of items that were well prepared. I have to single out Nikki at the front desk. She gave me the quiet room I requested without hesitation and understands what "hospitality" means in the hospitality industry. The room was impeccably cleaned every day. It is in a convenient location. It's all good. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful experience"”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel ten days on a trip that combined business and vacation. The staff were exceptionally attentive, helpful and friendly. Our room was spacious, clean and very well appointed. I usually have difficulty sleeping away from home, but the bed was so comfortable, it wasn't a problem. The breakfasts served were excellent, with hot cereal, eggs, potatoes, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. The "happy hour for guests" (Monday - Wednesday) consisted of light refreshments and soup, salad and snack foods. The weather was a bit cool, so we didn't use the pool. Our room was pool-side during spring break week, but no noise difficulties. We received exceptional service from all staff, (the three Chris's, Evan, John, Kelly, Anail and Angela and others). The wireless signal for our room was weak, so I could only access online with the plug in access. There was an issue with music noise at night from a recently opened nearby club. Hotel management is working with the new business to resolve this. Also, no safe in the room, but had a safety deposit box in the lobby available at no charge. To sum it up, this hotel has a very convenient location, superb staff, great rooms and good food at a reasonable price. We are returning for a conference in October and will definitely stay at the Residence Inn Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: My company had our group stay here for a convention and the hotel and staff are excellent. One of the nicest Residence Inn's I've stayed at! Nice variety for breakfast. The entire staff is very courteous and helpful! Our entire group had a terrific stay. Great location in the Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for meetings”
Reviews.Author: pecinha
Reviews.Content: really surprised with this hotel, 2 blocks from convention center,very well runned and the concierge was rate 10 because of the great attention from kelly and cathy. they really make the difference, always smillig (wich is rare in chain hotels), they gave us great hints for restaurants etc..., only one "BIG PROblem": when i was entering the elevator two dogs (size of a small horse) with their owner. form that time on I was thinking that dogs like those could have been walking on my room carpet and that's disgusting. they shouldn't accept pets like those.very good breakfast included in rate.

Reviews.Title: “I would pay double the valet fee!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie K
Reviews.Content: The first impression is always the most important thing in a business. Generally starting with a phone call but these days reservations are made online. So with that said our first impression started with the valets AMAZING! My door was opened with a big smile and greeting, our bags were unloaded and taken inside and things just kept getting better. Front desk service is fantastic, rooms are impeccable, and the breakfast is not bad for a buffet. When we phoned for our car it was waiting for us curbside EVERYTIME and the valets had great recommendations for restaurants. We love this hotel and hope to stay here on every business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JaeBee2010
Reviews.Content: For a family staying downtown, this was a fabulous hotel. We enjoyed one suite, with a kitchen, sitting area and sofa bed, for the price of a regular hotel room anywhere else. The location was excellent - walking distance to everything downtown and a block away from the 5th Avenue restaurants, yet it was quiet. Breakfast is included; not amazing, but decent. Everyone was so friendly and the parking staff were particularly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: AHM
Reviews.Content: Attending a meeting at convention center with family including two kids. This was a very well run and maintained property. Excellent staff from valet to practically everybody else we interacted with. It is new'ish and clean. Smack in middle of gas lamp area but not the noisy part i.e. it is a block away. It is 5 min walk to convention center. I had a AAA package which included valet parking. I did not try it but the family said the breakfast waffles and everything else there were excellent as well. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because the rooms are much smaller than expected from my past experience with the brand. But I still highly recommend it if visiting with kids or for longer stays if you want to have a kitchen. I would not recommend it if you are traveling with more than one kid and plan on staying more than two nights because it is too cramped for that long since you have to open the sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Marriott stay ever”
Reviews.Author: auntpp
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to Maria Elena - my 9th floor housekeeper (room 904) who took special care of me all week. Made my long stay so comfortable. Staff at this hotel is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: doopysmiles3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Gaslamp on a long weekend. The staff was very helpful. Nikki was able to check us in early when we got into San Diego earlier than planned. Cathy made dinner reservations for us. The only downside of the stay was a little bit of street noise that I'm sensitive to. As always, Residence Inn has a great breakfast. All in all it was a great trip. I plan on staying there again when I'm back for business.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Annie C
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 2yrs old and I stayed at this hotel and our customer experience was fabulous. We travelled world wide and we can say without any doubt that the service we received there was simply the best. United Airlines broke the handle of our stroller and they were not able to find it. When we arrived at the hotel, we mentioned this to the front desk employee and by the time we checked in, she had find and called a luggage store nearby to get it fixed. From the front desk to the valet parking, each employee provided great personalized advices (restaurants, attractions to visit, grocery stores etc.). The hotel is also perfectly located. Many attractions are walking distance (Stadium, the Horton's Plaza Mall, Seaport Village, children playground) and for those who are further away, the trolley station is a block away. We stayed in several Residence Inn hotels, this is simply the best. The room was a good size, clean, comfortable and soundproof. The free breakfast was very good, same for hotel restaurant. We would go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyOhio
Reviews.Content: Arrived Saturday and got lucky with street parking. We did not pay for valet during our stay. We called earlier in the day to request a king bed. We were not able to select that online. They said they noted our request. At check-in we were told that they only had queens available. If we had been staying more than 2 nights this would have been a big problem for us but the check-in staff was very friendly. The room was very nice. The layout of the room. was a little strange. The bathroom sink is right next to the bed outside of the bathroom door. The breakfast selection was very nice and the staff was very attentive and cleaned up the tables after people were finished very quickly. Very nice stay. Really glad we had the car to explore more of the area. Ocean Beach, Old Town, Balboa Park and Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Great people at the desk. Good value for our money. Convenient location to explore the Gaslamp Quarter and the San Diego Zoo. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: terri9AnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Didnt expect this property to be so nice. Good staff, good location, great accommodations. Was crowded at breakfast time, tho, but that was the ONLY negative. We solved this by hitting breakfast earlier the second morning.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to san diego”
Reviews.Author: Julia P
Reviews.Content: Great experience, great location. Nicolette was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and conference center”
Reviews.Author: Kurt M
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn in the heart of the San Diego Gas Lamp district is an outstanding place to stay or to have a business conferences. The rooms and the facilities are new and modern. Great bar to hang out in the evenings and you are right in the heart of the gas lamp district that has ample restaurants, clubs, and shopping. The staff are the friendliest I have ever encountered. We held a conference at this location and everything went great. Ruby the Events Coorindator went to the extreame to make sure everything was great. I would definitely go back to this hotel again for vacation or a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: flyn2lax
Reviews.Content: Nicki at the front desk started our visit out with a smile and never stopped amazing us with her personality and kindness. We were allowed to check in early and shortly after checking in we received a knock at the door with a personalized letter welcoming us and wishing me a happy birthday with her desire to hear all about our adventures. The valets were very personable, and nice. Each of the employees that we encountered took the time to say hello. The breakfast crew in the mornings were efficient and welcoming as well. The breakfast offered something for everyone with hot and cold dishes available. The pool area was nice, although there is no jacuzzi. The rooms were very nice, but the sliding doors of the bathrooms were able to be heard from one room to another. The sink area was more suited to a single person. the kitchen was well equipped and even came with microwave popcorn. The location was perfect for exploring Gaslamp, the Embarcadero and Seaport Village. Overall, this was a fabulous experience with a lot of it due to Nicki and her warm and inviting welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: Annew1217
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego & stayed one night & asked to be upgraded to a one BR suite (Platinum member). Friendly front desk person at check-in. The location is near the Gas Lamp district & we walked to the marina & Sea Port village. The room was spacious enough with a sliding door to separate the living room. Dark wood furniture which made it modern & cozy. Small kitchen included. Clean and well appointed. Wonderful breakfast buffet included. The waffles were delish! Parking is $35 but we were able to find street parking on Sunday (free). We were on the side where there is a club & on Sat. night you can here the music from our room, however, we were watching tv late into the night so it didn't really bother us. We used the gym, but not the pool. They have 2 elipticals & 2 treadmills with tv viewing on each machine. This hotel is fairly new. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This preggo lady LOVED the breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: JLH334
Reviews.Content: First: The complementary breakfast was AMAZING. I'm pregnant and famished when I wake up, so I appreciated the wide selection. Every day there was oatmeal with lots of toppings, waffles with lots of toppings, fresh fruit, assorted pastries, cereal, yogurt, sausage, eggs, and every day there was a different special, like breakfast sandwiches or a sausage and potato scramble. SOOOOO delicious, esp. since my conference only offered a muffin and bagle continental breakfast. Second: I stayed in town (Wed. - Sun.) for a conference. The hotel was a very short walk from the conference center. Also, I had a roommate and we switched back and forth with the hide-away bed and both found it to be very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They hailed me a cab when I was checking out and were always available to answer my qeustions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: rexbo
Reviews.Content: Decent room, although showing somehow unusual settings, with the sink and vanity mirror between the bed and the wall mounted tv. Great location, in walking distance from everything downtown. Parking tip: for those who find the hotel valet parking a little on the high side, there are overnight public parkings on the 6th, 2-4 minutes walks away. In the ACE PARKING across the street at 298 on 6th, I paid $13 for one night, 9 for 2nd, and 11 for the 3rd night. The hotel internet connection range does not fully cover the gym area:( There are two treadmills, two elipticall machines and a byke in the small gym area, which can get very crowded in the morning:( Be prepared to pay $3/page, if you want to send a fax from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay during quiet season”
Reviews.Author: apodis10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights (Monday-Friday) during what was probably a non-convention time. The hotel was mostly quiet and restaurants weren't packed. I think this probably made a (positive) difference. Check-in was very quick as was check-out. Staff was friendly. The hotel, as others have mentioned, is quite new. The hotel was well situated to shopping, good dining and the obvious, convention center and ballpark. There is a CVS 2 blocks down which was nice for things I forgot to pack and didn't want to check if the hotel had any. My room was very nice. Clean, well laid-out. I only made use of the kitchenette for the refrigerator. It is a full sized refrigerator. The dishes, pans, utensils, etc. were ample. The bathroom was impeccably clean noting that the the sink is outside of the sliding bathroom "door". I had 2 (non-opening) windows in my room. The bed was reasonably comfortable. My colleague's room was slightly different in layout but not by much. His room was also impeccably clean and tidy. Internet wasn't charged which is nice since the Marriott across the street and, well, basically all other nearby hotels charge for it. I saw other guests at the computer terminals in the lobby though I didn't personally take part. The breakfast was fairly standard. My colleague and I ate there once but decided to try local restaurants for the other breakfasts. We didn't partake of the happy hour. I noticed that in the room, you can make a grocery list and they will shop for you (plus a convenience fee) which I thought was kind of neat. The valets were very quick. They always opened the doors for the passengers. The car was always quick to arrive. They even began to know our faces so they didn't need to ask for the tag. $35/day for parking is a little ridiculous even though it is the regular price anywhere nearby. I can't really blame them for keeping up with the Jones's. There is not a self-parking option. I used the coin laundry not the send-away laundry option. It was convenient. There were probably 6 washers and 6 driers. The change machine didn't work but the front desk was able to give me change. My only complaint with the laundry was that I had NO idea how long the drier was going to take. Some of the machines had timers on them but many did not. I certainly wasn't going to wait around until it finished but I really didn't know when to come back. Since no one else was using the machines at the time, it wasn't a big deal that my laundry hijacked a machine after finishing and before I returned. The workout room was clean and stocked. There were towels, antibacterial wipes, lotion and water. There were TVs on the (2) treadmills and (2) ellipticals in addition to one on the wall for people who were weightlifting. It is a small hallway with windows on either side. I served its purpose and was more than I have had at other similar hotels. The only complaints I had were minor. First, as others have noted, the walls are paper-thin. Inside walls and outside walls. So, in addition to the sirens outside (not often), I could easily hear my neighbor up puking all night. Fortunately, (s)he only occupied the room that 1 night. Because the hotel wasn't fully occupied, the sounds of doors opening/closing wasn't a big deal. If it had been full, I would probably have been driven crazy by the noise. The second complaint was that the hotel staff didn't know much about some of the restaurants nearby. When I asked for recommendations, neither the staff at the front desk nor the 2 valets could give me a recommendation. I was asking about 3 different restaurants and none of them had been to any of those 3. It is very helpful as an out of town guest for the hotel staff to have at least visited the restaurants within walking distance (3 blocks even) so they can make personal recommendations. Again this is a very minor point. The third complaint I had was that you had to use your room key to get anywhere in the hotel. You had to insert it to take the elevator up/down. You had to use it to get into the pool area and again to get into the workout room. It became a hassle, especially when my room key wasn't keyed well, so it sometimes took 5 tries for it to register. I finally took the key to the desk and got a replacement. The only other minor thing to note is that there is a small place for smokers. It is immediately when you leave the 3rd floor headed out to the swimming pool. So, you have to walk past the billows of smoke to go to the pool or workout room. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. I typically only stay at Hiltons or Hilton chains (Embassy Suites or other). This was my first stay at a Residence Inn and I was delighted. I will consider these in the future. I would also stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, helpful staff, surprisingly nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_JC
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for business. The location is central to the Gaslamp District, with restaurants and bars three short blocks from the hotel. The staff treated me like royalty. With an upper-floor location and pool view, my room was large, quiet, and nicely-furnished. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, and stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for downtown Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: MtgPlannerLA
Reviews.Content: I booked our weekend stay here and was pleasantly surprised by hotel (being in a busy downtown area). Rooms are beautiful, sound proof and very well maintained. Breakfast was plentiful and offered a nice variety of items. Parking is expensive but there are other offsite options close by. Walking distance to some of the best restaurants in San Diego, Petco Park and convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RoyU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a quick 1 week vacation to San Diego. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel at the beginning of our trip, left travelling for 2 nights and then returned for our last night before flying out. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and professional. They made is really feel at home and were very helpful in all regards. I got a great AAA rate when I booked online not expecting too much. On arrival and check in I felt I had hit the jackpot. This hotel has a simple but elegant feel. Our suite was comfortable and clean. The exercise facility and pool area were well maintained and perfect for our purposes. We never made use of the lobby bar but others seemed to be enjoying it. The daily, included breakfast, exceeded our expectations with hot scrambled eggs, potatoes & meats. Additionally there was assortment of cereals, yogurts, breads, juices and coffee. There was always a selection of fresh fruit too. The location is right in the middle of the trendy Gaslamp Quarter with scores of restaurants, bars and shops in the immediate area. It's a short walk to the convention center and has easy access to buses and the tram for longer trips. Even though it was in a busy area it was very quite in our room. I would definitely stay here again - especially if I got the great rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ITravel4Business_12
Reviews.Content: Parking is downside of hotel. Other than that everything else was fabulous. The location was a plus. Breakfast was a nice touch and the food kept coming.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location and a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler247
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at the Residence Inn was amazing. My sister and I were visiting San Diego in November. We choose the hotel for it's great location and closeness to the convention center, which was only a 4 block walk away. From the beginning the staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The bell boys, front desk staff, maid service and morning breakfast staff all made our stay at the hotel amazing. The area in itself was also great. The Gas Lamp is a busy area with numerous restaurants for eating and stores to shop in. In the evening many of the homeless come out, which makes the area seem a little seedy, but I've heard this is the case all over California. We arrived at the hotel early for check in, but the staff was happy to give us a room. We had booked a King bed, but our room had a Queen. When we mentioned this to the staff they were more than happy to change us to a room with a bigger bed. The rooms themselves were beautiful. From the decor to the kitchen, which had every tool and device I could ask for, the room was contemporary and comfortable. Being from NY I can tell you that the entire room would be the envy of any resident used to small apartment living. One of the other reasons we chose the hotel was for the morning breakfast that was included. I had to arrive early at the convention so I didn't want the hassle of trying to find someplace to eat. I was pleasantly surprised at the diversity of the food that was offered. They had different types of hot/cold cereal, breads, hot eggs, sausage and a waffle maker so you can custom make your own waffles. Of course, coffee/tea and various juices. All presented in a very clean and pleasant atmosphere, albeit a little small for the number of people that were staying at the hotel. At the end of our stay, checkout was a breeze. I had an early morning flight to catch and had to leave before breakfast. When I inquired about where I could get breakfast before leaving they told me not to worry. The breakfast attendant was there and he made me up a box of food to take with me on my trip home. It was so very nice of them. If I return to San Diego I will definitely be staying at the Residence Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing dog friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: WISCGirl
Reviews.Content: One word description - wow! We stayed here over Christmas 2011 and despite the hotel being fully booked with tons of dogs and kids, the staff was absolutely amazing! The front desk and bell stand were not just staffed but over-staffed. We never had to stand in line for long without someone answering our questions. Our room was very comfortable and quiet even though we were surrounded by neighbors. The complimentary breakfast was terrific but the staff could not keep up with the demand during prime eating times over the holiday weekend. It probably also didn't help that kids were running wild and grabbing things off the buffet left and right without adult supervision. Is a 5 year old really going to eat 4 yogurts? No, he didn't and I'm sure other guests would have appreciated the excess. The place if very dog friendly. You pay $50 for the privilege of staying with your dog and you get nothing in return like a pet goody bag offered by other hotels. Tip: The bar lobby is totally dog friendly. You can enjoy drinks and appetizers with your pooches. The bartender had two dogs of her own and she was terrific about coming over to socialize with our dogs so we had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandshell
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest Residence Inn I've ever stayed in. Beautiful lobby and friendly, helpful staff. Room was comfortable and had everything we needed. Hotel is within walking distance to all the Gaslamp Quarter has to offer. Free breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: Dana W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for one night and was pleasantly surprised on how nice the room was and you couldn't ask for a better location if you want to explore the many bars and restaurants of the Gas Lamp district. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and were happy to point you in the direction of a great restaurtant. I would definately stay here next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Home Run”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: We used the Residence Inn Gaslamp as one of the room block hotels for the weekend of our wedding, and I could not be happier with the decision. The staff was courteous and helpful to all of our guests, the rooms and common areas were lovely, and the location is incomparable. It's such a relief to deal with a business (hotel or otherwise) with a culture of professionalism--it is clear that customer service and quality of presentation are a serious priority at Residence Inn Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for families but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Bradg1998
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Gaslamp for 5 nights in November while my wife attended a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel was nice - clean, centrally located, and having an excellent staff, but there is certainly room for improvement. The Good: The hotel seems relatively new and the design is modern and sleek. The staff was wonderful and accommodating in every way, truly making us feel at home. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which was very helpful when you need to put a 2 year old to bed at 8pm while Mom and Dad still want to watch TV or read in the living area until later in the evening. The hotel's location is excellent, right in the middle of the Gaslamp tourist area, the Convention Center, and the baseball stadium. The Bad: It is very noisy outside in the evening. There are many clubs/bars in the area, and we heard music pumping/girls screaming until the wee hours of the morning nearly every night. The complimentary breakfast is nice (and substantive), with cereals, eggs, pancakes, yogurt, waffles, etc. each morning. However the food often ran out and there didn't seem to be enough to handle the amount of people staying at the hotel. Parking is valet only, and costs $35 a day (which seemed quite expensive considering numerous off-site parking lots nearby). Overall, a good place and we did enjoy our time there. At its price point (the low $200's) per night, you get a good value for a 1 bedroom suite. That being said, it's not perfect and we would consider other options the next time we travel to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “WILL COME BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: Silvia P
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Walking distance to many2 things. Restaurants/stores/mall. Complementery breakfast and evening snacks on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday. The room is nice and big, with kitchen, large fridge, microwave. Sliding door to the bathroom with lock. in terms of design it's very different compared to all the residence Inn, I have stayed in. Friendly staff during breakfast and evening snacks, don't forget to tip them a few bucks will make their day. Valet will cost $35, but it's no secret since they tell you that on their website. You can find alternative parking, as long as you don't go in and out. We parked our car next door for $15 for the night, and we went places during the day, so it worked out perfectly. There are so many meter parking too. If you are coming with your family this hotel would be spacious enough, plus there is a sofa bed. The pool is on the rooftop, so we didn't use because it wasn't warm enough, even when the water is heated. Overall a great hotel, and only a few miles away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jan V
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the Gaslamp quarter. Rooms were big and clean. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Valet parking for 35 USD a day. Breakfast is complementary and was very good. There's a swimmingpool and some fittness equippment on the 3rd floor. Lots of stores and restaurants in the area and the San Diego convention center is within walking dinstance (5=10 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: sunnski
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days. Nice room with filtered views of the bay. This is in a good central location to the Gaslamp area, waterfront and convention center along with Petco Park. Staff very friendly and knowledgeable. Lobby clean and modern. Check in was easy. They have complimentary meal service in the evenings only on M-T-W. I know this is an extended stay hotel but I think it needs to be on Thursday too. Full breakfast served seven days a week. I had bagels and yogurt. But there were eggs, cereal, juices, fruit etc if you like breakfasts. Rooms were clean. Maid service was OK. Didn't clean the toilet at least one time. But there is a full kitchen to use if you want to cook. I would stay here again without hesitation. Elevators were quick. Rooms were quite and AC worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Un Expected Charges”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We had requested a room with 2 beds and were assured that this would not be a problem. They offered us foam pillows, which we agreed would be better for us. They did not mention that the only parking available would be valet at $35.00 per night. We arrived and they did not have a room with 2 beds, no foam pillows were available and because there was a game at the stadium close by there was absolutely no option except the valet parking. We had used our reward points for this stay and were very disappointed with the cavalier attitude that since we were not â€œpayingâ€� customers we did not deserve to be treated with consideration. We spent 25,000 points for this stay and felt that we should have had a better experience for the investment.

Reviews.Title: “Above the high standard for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: I selected this property based on Trip Advisor advice. I was Not disappointed. The room was commodious and clean. The fitness center was adequate but everything was operational. Breakfast was hot and well-prepared. The staff are typical Marriott-trained and very courteous. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so functional.”
Reviews.Author: Ogilviesonthego
Reviews.Content: We booked this because of an extended stay in San Diego and wanted a kitchen. The location can't be beat. And the staff were wonderful and friendly. We ended up not really using the kitchen since space was limited. We'd like to also be able to open windows and our temp in our room was never right no matter how much we tried to adjust it. We would also appreciate a hot tub in the pool area! If you just need a hotel room and want to be in Gaslamp you probably can't beat this.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: I booked a block of rooms for myself and some of my co-workers. Ruby Grieme was amazing, with all my shifting and changing arrangements up to the last minute. Even with all of the changes everything went smoothly. Upon arrival we were greeted with amazing, professional and friendly staff. The rooms were awesome, the hotel was pleasant and immaculate, and we could walk to all of our different destinations. The highlight for me were the wonderful Valet Team Members. Every one of them was pleasant, professional and really made you feel good when you returned to the hotel. I would like to especially thank Tony Heath, one of the shift managers, who always had a great smile and pleasant greeting whenever I saw him. The Manager of this hotel has a wonderful staff that he should be proud of. I will definitely stay here again if I ever return to San Diego. Thank you everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: gregoDfw
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, the location is great and the rooms nice and new but..... They don't have rooms with two real beds. They only have a King or 1 queen with a pull out sofa. For two adults, who gets the pull out?? The bathroom is odd with the vanity in the main room, sliding barn door that is not very private and a nice glass shower that leaks all over the floor. It does come with a full kitchen, but was wasted space for us. The morning breakfast and eveing social hour were disorganized at best, bordering on disaster. Seems no one was in charge - pretty much a free for all. They continually ran out of items and the serving space is so small it was like running an obstacle course - and we were there during the week, can't imagine what it is like on a busy weekend with a ton of kids. One day the ran out of plates and silverware. Would definitely consider staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great time”
Reviews.Author: MicheleKL
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to this hotel for a weekend event we were attending in the Gaslamp Quarter, and we are so glad we stayed here. The location was fantastic-- within very short walking distance to Petco Park, the convention center, tons of great restaurants, shopping, movies, and Horton Plaza. And the Gaslamp Quarter is hopping in Friday and Saturday nights... just like you see in bigger cities like Chicago and New York! The hotel is fairly new, was very clean, and the staff was very friendly. There is a gym with a couple of elliptical machines, a couple treadmills, a bike, and a free weight set, and it overlooks 5th street below. The pool, only 3 feet deep, is on a rooftop and next to the gym. The room was well-laid-out but cozy with a bed, small couch and flat-screen TV that moved around, a little kitchen (and they offer to do your grocery shopping for free!), and dishes and utensils for your use if you decide to cook in the room. (Again, there are tons of great places to eat nearby... kind of hard to resist!) We would definitely stay here again. The regular rate for the room was $500 a night, according to the placard on the door... kind of steep, but we got a deal with the group we were with... and so for a similar rate up to $250/night, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: skamikirn
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying here and was very impressed. Located in the Gaslamp district and within walking distance from everything - Petco Park, Convention Center, plenty of restaurants, bars, theater, Horton Plaza. Also very close to San Diego Zoo and the museums. Everybody was so friendly from the valet staff to the front desk to the housekeeping. Rooms were very clean which included a kitchenette - fridge, stove, microwave, plates, cups. Widescreen TV was offcenter from the bed which I thought was interesting, but it was adjustable so it wasn't bad. Don't know if it's like that for all the rooms though. Had a view of the pool (located on the 3rd floor) which looked small and the gym. Comfy bed, shower no tub. Internet is free as well as the breakfast buffet from 7a-10a on the 2nd floor. They serve scrambled eggs, potato pancakes, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, waffles, yogurt parfait, cereal, bagels, toast, fruits, juice, coffee (am i missing anything?). There is a bar in the lobby called Barvie. Didn't get to check it out. If you're an elite member, you get complimentary chips and salsa from the bar. The only downside to this hotel is the mandatory $35 a day valet. You really can't get away from it unless you park elsewhere. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of it all”
Reviews.Author: jmarone1969
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. During power outage bar stayed open thanks to generators! Power was supplied in the lobby area as well, people from all over Gaslamp were there powering their laptops and cell phones. Hotel staff was fantastic! Only knock is that it would be nice if you can crack the windows open a bit to get some fresh air in the rooms instead of having to rely on the A/C or heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Perfect room, lightning fast internet”
Reviews.Author: investroll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the San Diego Convention center as well as the stadium. I stayed here for a conference at the convention center. (There are four Marriotts in the area, so be sure you know which one you are booking.) The room is very comfortable, with a full size refrigerator and a functioning kitchenette. I slept like a rock. The internet is a hard wired super fast (40 MB/sec ! ) connection and there is no extra charge, which is even better. Everything was clean and quiet, and the staff was friendly. They provide a hot breakfast buffet with the room. The buffet is basically a serve-yourself on disposable plates kind of buffet. The hot means they have scrambled eggs, a waffle maker, and sausage or grits . There are also lots of interesting places to eat, as this hotel is in the heart of the nice Gaslamp section of town. Parking is expensive ($34/night) but you don't really need a car if you are only going to a convention. Taxi from the airport was only $14, and the trolley system is close by but not so close as to send noise to the rooom. I want to come back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if going to Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: sulphursister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Gaslamp for one night following a Padres game. Very close to the ball park. Got a screaming deal on the room via price line.com. $179 for a queen city view room. Room 1402 (top level) has view of convention center, Coronado, downtown, Point Loma and even the Bay through the buildings. NICE! Has a pullout sofa bed, full size fridge, well equipped kitchenette. Really nice buffet breakfast included...eggs, bacon, sausage, etc...not the typical continental breakfast fare. Pay parking. Best value for a nice hotel in the gas lamp. There is no room service. John at the front desk is very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Easy 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Rolayna
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice within the last two years, including the week after it opened for business, and have nothing bad to say. It is updated, modern, and comfortable. The lobby is inviting, and its location in the Gaslamp district provides access to a lot of entertainment and dining options, and Petco Park is a couple of blocks away (San Diego Padres play there, and I recommend seeing this park even to non-sports enthusiasts). Giving this hotel 5 stars is a no-brainer for me. I've also recommended it to friends and colleagues who have all had great experiences. I recommend Richard Walker's for Breakfast (the wait is worth it), and Mickey Rotten's casual fair, and Nobu for dinner. A lot of other options, but these stood out from the rest for me, and both Mickey Rotten's and Nobu are within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely”
Reviews.Author: vonbe123
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great staff, spacious rooms and a fab roof top bar. Breakfast was also amazing. Central location and you can even see baseball games from the roof top bar. Nothing bad to say about the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, beware of street noise”
Reviews.Author: Sweetee Pie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while traveling with a 2 year old and found that overall it was a good stay. PROS: -close to a lot of restaurants and shops by foot, no need to always drive (Horton shopping plaza, Richard Walker pancake house, etc.) -breakfast included with your stay (waffles, yogurt, fruit, hot food such as scrambled eggs, oatmeal, ham) -suite units have kitchenette which makes it very handy to store bottled water, snacks, meals, etc. -clean units -free WIFI -non smoking hotel -close to freeway -close to PetCo Park CONS: -$35 valet parking (although you do get in and out privileges), if you want to park yourself you'll have to park it at some of the other parking lots and walk back to the hotel. Not a big deal but we were there the long weekend and parking was limited -street noise can be loud at times even though we were on the 11th floor (the occasional suped up car or loud motorcycle could be heard) -no bathtub (we had a standup shower only and it made it challenging to bathe a 2 year old) Although the room has sliding doors to separate the living room and washroom. Don't expect 100% privacy. The sliding doors have frosted glass so light and shadows will be seen. Bed is fair although I do prefer the ones at Hampton Inn. The Queen bed we had was a little too bouncy and soft for my liking. It almost felt like plywood on top of springs. We would definitely stay here again. The staff were very helpful, friendly and eager to help us. Room was very clean and we had no issues asking for extra linens. The kitchenette came in real handy since we bought some groceries and were able to bring them back with us. Note: long weekend in September is very busy around the city. Make preparations in advance to book your hotel. 99% of hotels will be completely sold out for that weekend. TIP: if you can, pack ear plugs for a more restful sleep due to the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLaRue3715
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego for a week and was very fortunate to have training in the Gas Lamp District. The Residence Inn was a perfect hotel, located in the perfect spot. The hotel is one block from Petco Stadium, in the middle of numerous great restaurants, and a short walk to the San Diego Convention Center. My room was very clean and modern. The kitchenette was stocked with everything a person would need for a meal or storing a snack. I was warned that late night parties in the area may keep a person awake night but this was not the case. I would recommend this hotel for both families and business travelers alike. A small breakfast was provided in the morning that was a great way to start the day. A restaurant was in the hotel but with so many great venues in the area I went out each night. Dont hesitate to stay and enjoy the local area from this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kllrmom
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely amazing. I've never met a more friendly staff. The valet were quick and courteous. Daily breakfast is included with your stay and its REAL breakfast. Valet is the only option for parking and its a little pricey ($35) a day. My family and I were there for a month and we had NO complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms, but it's a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelchyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District. There are great restaurants and bars within a short walk from the hotel. (There is a great cupcake place called Heavenly Cupcakes that is two blocks away from the hotel.) The hotel is nicely decorated and the rooms are nice. I was staying on the 11th floor and we could still hear the street noise in the evenings. Parking costs $37 per night but you have in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: jhaf
Reviews.Content: After a not so great stay at another property up the road, we were stunned with the amazing service and amenities that Residence had to offer. Sara, the front desk supervisor, and Evan, the bartender and service rep, knew us by name and took great care to ensure we were pleased with every aspect of our stay on a daily basis. Mona, at the front desk, was also very helpful in assisting with directions, places that were close by as well as recommendations for dining. I would recommend staying here to anyone. I have never had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl006
Reviews.Content: Terrific new hotel - two blocks from Petco park, about 15 minute walk to Horton Plaza and close to lots of restaurants and shopping. Easy to find and close to airport. Staff was friendly and helpful. Special kudos to Emily and Ruby for their help arranging a room block for us. Very accommodating. Would not hesitate to recommend this property - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dmbeland
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel.. The staff and accommodations are excellent.. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: studentwork
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect room in the corner not far from the elevator. We also loved the fact that the room came with pots, plates and silverware. We were there for comic-con, but once we got to our room, we never heard any of the outside noise. The only down fall was the windows in the room don't open if your cooking something. At times the room got smoky and the vent didn't work that great. All in all we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aloudnoise
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was an excellent hotel, more modestly priced than a lot of the hotels close to the convention center. A full kitchen, with a regular-sized fridge is included in all the rooms. Highlights: Excellent wifi, much better than most hotels; soft towels; incredibly friendly staff. Low points: Breakfast is adequate, with some days better than others; parking is $35 per day. I really enjoyed my stay here, and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great place to stay near the Convention Center and PETCO Park, this is a good choice. My wife and I stayed here 8 nights for a conference and were very pleased. We had a good room rate that incuded complimentary breakfast and WiFi. We were greeted by staff every time we came in, and they kindly took care of any requests or provided information about local businesses. The rooms are mini suites with a fully equipped kitchen, nice bathroom, very comfortable bedding and large flat panel TV. Climate control in the room worked well and was very quiet. They take security rather serious here, and you must use your room key card to make he elevator go anywhere except the Lobby level. So, don't forget your key card when you leave your room. The breakfast area on 2nd floor is nice and they offer a decent selection of foods, included in your room rate. But if you want to pay for a big breakfast, go right across the street to Broken Yolk. The pool on 3rd floor is rather small, and there is a fitness center next to the pool. But, I did a lot of walking each day and didn't want to ride a bike to nowhere or walk on a conveyor belt on this trip. Yes, I'll definitely try to book a room here next year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and the staff was very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: sweetmeg1980
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was amazing. The front desk staff was very friendly, the room was spacious with a wonderful view and the location was wonderful. Everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lost luggage made better by wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tara_LM
Reviews.Content: Steve and Rebecca, the night crew, really helped me feel more comfortable when I hadn't received my luggage AND was starving in the middle of the AM! They were more than helpful to get me milk to drink with my vitamins (as I am quite nauseous/pregnant) before breakfast was even open!! This hotel and the people (from valet attendants to those working at the Front Desk) have definitely been the saviour when the rest of the trip so far (first night) hasn't been going as planned!! :) Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: travelgal63
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here previously but I had some addtional thoughts on this hotel after our most recent stay. My husband was there on business and I joined him. The front desk people are always friendly, the valets, after a few days, had my husband's car out front prior to him even going out to get the car. They also were tripping over each other to open the hotel door, car doors, always asking if we needed directions. I have to say, all the hotel staff were the best I have run across.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: dmbRJR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is very new and updated with nice spacious rooms. The hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter and just a block or two from Petco Park. It made for a perfect location for us and puts you in the center of great restaurants and bars. Hotel staff was good and the valet guys were awesome! There is a fitness center and pool on the third floor. The pool is small and just OK but workable if you are there for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suites in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DBAToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Residence Inn for a conference followed by a family holiday. We had debated about moving to another hotel further from the Convention Center after the conference ended, but decided to stay put. We're glad we did! The staff were exceptionally friendly and warm. They were very accommodating with our rambunctious kids running through the lobby, and knew their names within a day. The location was great: close to lots of restaurants, shops and cafÃ©s. Short walking distance to the Convention Center and to Horton Plaza. We had a large, one-bedroom suite which had lots of space for the two kids to run around in and lots of windows to bring in light. It was kept extremely clean each day. The well-stocked kitchen facilities were very handy with modern appliances. The guest laundry was a valuable feature, and the small swimming pool was warm. My only complaint would be the breakfast buffet. The food was mediocre and sometimes ran out before the end of the breakfast period, but the staff were very friendly. The valet parking with the hotel was $35. The neighboring lot was only about $15â€“$20 per day â€” so if you don't need in-and-out privileges, it's a much better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: TSchenk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights in this great downtown hotel for a conference being held at the Hilton. The rooms have a wonderful home appeal. The decorators did a great job with the furnishings. The staff were all very friendly and responsive to our needs. This visit was for business and we were able to ship our demo equipment to and from the hotel without any additional charges. The hotel that hosted the conference we attended wanted $50 to $100 per box for the same service. The hotel is within short walking distance to a World Market and a full service Ralph's grocery store that also had beer and wine. Several evenings the hotels happy hour snacks were enough for our entire dinner. One evening they served a full spaghetti dinner. The free breakfast was also very nice and changed each morning so you didn't get bored with the same standard offerings most hotels present.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently the best”
Reviews.Author: Hofleydrew
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel three or four times per year. It is consistently an outstanding experience. The quality and cleanliness of the property are far above average, but the thing that really sets it apart is the personnel. The valets, front desk staff, breakfast staff and housekeepers are always professional, positive and courteous. I would like to especially call out Mona Long at the front desk. She is always a pleasure to deal with but on my most recent visit I left my government ID and credit card mistakenly at the desk. Mona took care of it until my return to the hotel two hours later. I am absolutely comfortable (and very appreciative) in Mona's professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at a Residence Inn and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to the Smooth music festival promoted by FM98.1 here in San Diego and didn't want to have to drive home that night so we stayed at the Residence Inn. We regularly stay at various Marriott hotels but this was our first stay at a Residence Inn. Excellent! Beautiful, very accommodating to those who are there on business or those who are vacationing. We were told by the front desk staff that they would even go grocery shopping and have the food in the kitchen if we so required for a stay. Now that is service. We will be back even though we live in San Diego. It's a great place to stay, close everything in the Gaslamp Quarter and well worth it. The only drawback was the hefty parking fee which the hotel has no control over due to it being contracted to a parking company.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service bad”
Reviews.Author: werefun
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the front desk clerk told us all he had was a Queen room, to which I replied, "You don't have any kings available?". He said, "We're very limited. We're sold out", which left me thinking "what exactly are you saving them for"? We're Marriott Rewards members, and my husband travels for business, spending between a month and three months each year at Marriotts. I asked again, "you don't have anything in a King?" to which he replied, "oh, I do have one available." The room was fine, other than some outdoor noise and the fact that the cable kept going out and the volume didn't work on the bedroom TV. When we checked out the receipt had 2 valet charges on it, although we used the garage next door. We brought it to the attention of the heavyset man at the front desk, who picked up the phone and said "I need you to verify that a customer didn't use the valet." He might as well have said "I need you to verify that this customer isn't lying", because that's what we heard. Another woman comes to the desk, and starts flipping through a book with names and room numbers - apparently a valet book. She spends approximately 3 minutes flipping pages before my husband says "you're not going to find our name because it's not in there", and she replies, "it could be under a different name". She continued to read the same pages over and over, convinced that we were liars. Wow. They eventually conceded that we were, in fact, not liars, and credited the charges. By that point, however, they had lost our business forever, and cost us over 10 minutes while they investigated THEIR mistake. The girl who eventually checked us out was named Mona, but the heavyset man wasn't wearing a nametag, nor was the tall, thin girl who is likely still looking for proof that we used the valet. The man never spoke again after making the initial phone call, and pointed anyone who walked up to him over to Mona for assistance, making them wait in line while he served no one. Both Mona and the other girl finally asked "How was your stay, other than this?" after I walked silently to the other end of the counter and picked up business cards for both the Guest Service Manager and TripAdvisor reviews. If they find this type of investigation necessary when encountering this type of error, they need to do it in the back room rather than at the counter. We'll never go to this Marriott again and I wouldn't recommend it either. There are too many other nice hotels in the area - try the U.S. Grant or the Omni or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: hillmel
Reviews.Content: every employee was very friendly and helpful-never had to wait to get help-location is great for being in the heart of gaslight but not where all the party noise is. Turn the ice maker off in refrig or it will wake you up in night with the clicking of the ice moving. In my room the wall tv was located in an odd place in relation to the bed- my friends room was ok. The wifi worked great-the computer in lobby for all to use worked great. The common area in lobby was very comfortable. The bed was too hard for my liking. They use those super cheap plastic sacks for the waste baskets which slip down into the basket

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bearcat39
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to San Diego was most enjoyable and the service and comfort at the Residence Inn Gaslamp was terrific. The room was very clean, the staff were friendly and very helpful especially Mona at the front desk. She was always smiling and super personality. The car guys were great and always greeted us leaving or returning to the hotel. Morning breakfast was great, and staff there were helpful. Overall, my wife and I had a most enjoyable time and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry for being cliche, but it's a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: RUtoSD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel frequently over the past year, so a lot of the staff has gotten to know me by name. It's a very friendly environment and I don't even think twice about booking a reservation anywhere else when I am traveling to The San Diego for business. As it's a suite, the kitchen amenities are sufficient enough to get me through extended (2 weeks or greater) travel stays. In particular, Erick and Emily at the front desk have been extremely accommodating with little things like an extra room key or bigger things like helping me to extend travel plans or changing travel dates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIKimber
Reviews.Content: For being on a business trip, this was certainly nice. I found it to be pricey because of the prime location, but my company was paying for it. I wouldn't be able to afford to stay there otherwise. I understand paying for parking when downtown, but I think $35 daily is excessive. But the valet personnel were on it! They had my car in custody and my bags in my room in no time, and when it was time to leave they were equally efficient. All staff was friendly and did their best to accommodate everything. I had a mistake on my bill and they quickly remedied it with a smile. The room has a full kitchen, which is a big plus. I'm dieting, so eating out isn't in my best interest at the moment. It gave me the flexibility to eat the way I want. The living area was spacious and the bed was comfy. It had a queen, but that was ok. The fitness room was nice, and had a nice view of the street outside. The only complaint I have there was that the windows faced the west and the sun was blinding in the late afternoon and there were no blinds to pull. The equipment was state of the art. High speed internet was free, and they served free breakfast in the mornings which allowed me to supplement my own food with fruit and yogurt, although they offered much more. The staff even offered to make eggs the way I wanted. The hotel was walking distance from PETCO staduim so getting to a Padre's game is easy and you don't have to try and park there. The Gaslamp District in San Diego has a lot of great restaraunts and clubs to partake in, so the location is certainly prime. I just wish I could have stayed longer for leisure and not had to work.

Reviews.Title: “Best Residence Inn Yet!”
Reviews.Author: StableProgramKris
Reviews.Content: From the moment I left my car with the friendly valet staff to the moment I (reluctantly) had to check out, I was completely satisfied with this hotel! I have stayed in Residence Inn facilities many times as that is my preferred hotel for longer business trips and this one was by far the best one yet. The rooms are beautifully appointed, comfortable, modern and clean. But one of the best features was the location. As a woman traveling alone, I felt completely safe walking out of the hotel right into the Gaslamp district. There were so many great restaurant and shopping choices, including a great outdoor mall that was a perfect (exercise) walking distance away. That was sweet to find - made my solo trip much less boring! The hotel staff were so friendly! I've stayed in two other Residence Inns in San Diego and have to say this one is the one I'll always select from now on when I'm visiting there.

Reviews.Title: “" You have to check this place out.... Wow" !!”
Reviews.Author: dessky
Reviews.Content: I had not been to the Gaslamp District in over 10 years, and was pleased to see all the fun places to go. I didn't know which hotel to pick, but have stayed at Marriots before and they always seemed nice. I was really blown away at the quality of this one -- from the valet and front desk, eveyone was super pleasant and accomodating. The room was over the top for the reasonable price. Everything from granite counters to great decor -- it was perfect. Do yourself a favor and check this place out -- it has very high value for the money, and right in the middle of everything. You won't be disappointed. Tom from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: awickedwench
Reviews.Content: First time visit to San Diego for a convention and the convention hotel was booked so we stayed here. What a delight. The staff was heloful and friendly. The rooms were roomy, comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was hot and delicious. And the location as perfect! It was close to our convention location and just a block off of all the fabulous dining and shopping of Fifth Avenue. We had the best time and not a single complaint about the hotel. Included a kitchen, a pullout sofa and free wifi! Just wonderful. We plan on staying there again next year when we come back for our convention again!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: juztincredable
Reviews.Content: I had a FANTASTIC stay! The staff was incredibly friendly and really helpful from the warm gentleman who checked us in (and was kind enough to move us when we weren't comfortable in our room) to the delightfully helpful woman who helped me figure out parking at Sea World and the Zoo and then checked us out while checking in on our conversations from the morning before. We felt incredibly well taken care of and the morning breakfast was delicious! Who doesn't love steel-cut oatmeal? Well...I might be the only one who loves it, but they also had a full spread of eggs, fresh fruit, waffles, a variety of yogurt, a variety of cereal, tons of beverage options and probably a bunch of other things I'm completely forgetting. The building is quite nice, great design and a perfect location close to just about everything. I highly recommend this location (so much so that I'm writing this from my phone as I'm heading back home!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: HunterMemphis
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. Super clean, super modern, the breakfast was awesome as well as the nightly snacks. Excellent location I would stay here every time I come to San Diego. Fantastic staff was super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTravels_11
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to grocery stores (Ralph's is the nicest), which is good because area restaurant prices are high. Easy walk (about a mile) to the waterfront and a short cab ride to Balboa Park and the zoo. Old Town Trolley is 2 blocks away. The hotel is very nice, but runs a little short on the manager's reception as compared to other Residence Inns that we have stayed at. There are no alcoholic beverages served compared to wine and beer at other Residence Inns that we have stayed at. The manager's reception was also offered only 3 nights during the week. Our room was a studio and well equipped with a table, two chairs and a living room area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable suites”
Reviews.Author: LoveJozi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, but a longer stay would have been welcomed. Nice and central. The gym is a bit small, but it is functional. Breakfast is a bit tricky with a lack of healthy options. The waffles were great - the scrambled eggs were not! Rooms are large and comfortable, and the small kitchenette is perfect for longer stays. Very comfy bed! Internet connection is free and fast. Staff professional and helpful. Other hotels include a free shuttle to the airport (Residence Inn does not do this). However, shuttles and taxis are readily available and relatively cheap.

Reviews.Title: “this is a great place”
Reviews.Author: buffy23
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our car we were greeeted by pleasant friendly staff. We arrived way earlier than the regular check in. No problem, there was room availableand in not time we were in our suite.. The front counter staff, valet parking and breakfast room staff counld not have been more pleasant and accomodatingl. Howeer, if you want info on the surrounding area and in fact all of San Diego it is better to ask the front desk staff as the valets didn't seem to know, but then that isn't their area of expertise. Any time we came back to the hotel we were greeted with "welcome back" from the valets/doormen. Anytime we left the hotel we were told "have a good day" We were certainly made to feel welcomed. The one bedroom was just great, not too big nor too small, and it had everything that we wanted. The full fridge and well equipped kitchen was great as we had a soon to be two year old who need sustance at any hour. The kid size bed was totally comfortable! Gaslamp area has so many bars and restaurants not exactly a family place to be but there were parks were nearby and the Martin Luther Walkway approximately two blocks away was a great place for a walk with our little one. The Old Town Trolley Tour was fabulous, though a bit pricey but the guide sure knew his stuff and you saw quite a bit and learned alot about San Diego. All in all we had wonderful time at the hotel and in the city. We would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: cnctravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well locate for tourists. Easy access in and out of town to major attractions, plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from locally, and gaslamp is relatively quiet for a large city. Be careful with parking (valet), $35 per night. I found a multi-storey car park 1 block down and across the road that was only $8. Overall though, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: HptRdsBldr
Reviews.Content: Spent three days here during our spring break vacation.Great location. Very accommodating and pleasant staff across the board. Good comp breakfast every day. Small but functional fitness room. Rooms were clean and spacious enough. If I had any "complaint" ( and I really don't), perhaps the daily parking at $35 a bit steep. But that goes with being in the city. I'd stay here again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: dean2800
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled up to the valet we felt very welcome. the hotels doors were opened for us and we were greeted with smiles. the lobby was nice, the room was very comfortable. the kitchen was great especially with 2 small children. the location is central to all the great dining in the area. no need to drive for food. the free breakfast was a hit. full breakfast not a boring continental. i will be sure to stay again. P.s. There is a pool !

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was very nice for a Residence Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Parke_Chris
Reviews.Content: Most of the Residence Inns I have stayed in have been nice but basic. This had much more. The dÃ©cor was modern with a nice bar in the lobby that was well lit for doing business but way too bright for having a romantic drink and conversation. The location is great with the heart of the Gaslamp district a block away and the ballpark across the street. The pool area was small but nice and my girlfriend said the gym was way too hot. And it must have been hot for her to say that. It sound like they need to put a couple fans in there. The room was very nice. The bed was very comfortable and the kitchen well stocked with everything you may want for cooking in your room. The cleanliness was outstanding. The only negatives were the lack of a good workspace in the room and the vinyl shower curtain liner needed to be replaced. Overall, it more than met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imua_Warriors
Reviews.Content: Valet were very attentive and always opened the front door for you even when I tried to sneak by. Free breakfast is a full breakfast, not just continental like in most other hotels. Room was nice, however, maid only made bed and changed towels. She never put ironing board away or wiped up around the bathroom sink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night just for a quick getaway. The location is great and you the room was wonderful. I enjoyed having a small kitchen to make dinner. I had brought some steaks and pasta for our dinner and the kitchen was well supplied for all my cooking needs. The breakfast buffet was really good and the variety of breakfast items were plentiful. I would recommend this hotel for families with kids to keep the cost down while traveling. San Diego is a beautiful city with a lot of fun shops and great restaurants. We ate in to save money but there are a lot of neat places to eat and have drinks. The only down side of this hotel is the parking fee of $32.00 a night. I will look for Residence Inn's in all the cities that I go to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kplusJx7
Reviews.Content: This property is great! The staff was very helpful, rooms extremely clean, and the kitchenette was a wonderful bonus. The location is fun - right in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter, a fun area full of dining choices and some shopping. The harbor is close by, too. It was a fun destination, and we never needed our car once we parked it. I do suggest parking in the public garage next door or across the street where it only cost $21 to park Sunday through Tuesday. I think the hotel charges $32 per day. Also, the USS Midway is within walking distance and was a very interesting tour. We would definitely choose this property for a return trip. Added bonus: the breakfast buffet is included, and it is better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for after work dining and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: TimInColorado
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block off 5th Avenue which is where the majority of the Gaslamp Quarter restaurants and bars are located. The hotel was in very good condition and the staff very helpful. I found the hotel to be very quiet, clean and comfortable considering it's downtown location. Everthing you want to do in San Diego is relatively close, so getting to the airport, Old Town, Mission Bay or even La Jolla was a fast trip from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jenjens1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise. The hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants nearby and it's only two blocks from the trolley station. The rooms are a little smaller than I've had at other Residence Inns, but were perfectly adequate for three of us. I was never aware of sounds in the hall or from other rooms. Big breakfast with eggs, sausage, make-your-own waffles, biscuits, hot and cold cereals, and much more. Breakfast room was always clean and picked up. Small pool, but big enough for a quick refreshing dip. The internet was fast and more reliable than what I have at home. After our cruise San Diego harbor was closed due to the tsunami threat, causing us to miss our flight and needing to spend another night in San Diego. We called the Residence Inn and they were very helpful. They actually remembered us from the week before and told us to come on over, they would take care of us. And take care of us they did. They were friendly and simpathetic to our frustration. Even the valet was great. When my daughter realized her cell phone had fallen out of her pocket in the cab, one of the valets ran a block and a half down the street waving his arms. The cab stopped and he got the phone for her. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VISIT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VMI69
Reviews.Content: The hotel visit was perfect. Great new facility and an even greater location!!!

Reviews.Title: “this place is AWESOME, plus its colse to everything... love it.!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike_horner
Reviews.Content: wonderful. we were a little loud and had a lot of fun. we will be back with another crowd in may. its my kids 21 b-day

Reviews.Title: “Spotty internet. Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: So, it's hard for me to not have my review tainted by the fact that I had trouble connecting to the internet and no one seemed to care. For me, being able to connect is a pretty big deal. The front desk was totally indifferent and gave me an offshore help desk, which after 45 minutes was able to assist. I called the front desk while waiting, and they simply told me that the internet was working for them and implied it was my computer. Eventually, the offshore folks called me back and helped me connect. Even once connected, the service was spotty. I really couldn't stay here for business, simply because I must have reliable internet. The rooms were very small, which was a suprise for a Residence Inn. There was the traditional frig, stovetop etc. However, it was tightly wedged within the room. The room certainly isn't any larger than a traditional downtown hotel. The bathroom vanity is actually in the room itself, which is just odd. I wouldn't stay in the room with anyone other than a spouse, because it's a little close. The location is really wonderful. However, looking around there are two very nice hotels within the same block. I certainly would consider investigating them if I were to return. The workout room was undersized. This is a fairly large hotel from a room number perspective. The workout room consists of two treadmills and two ellipticals. Wake up early if you are planning on working out or do some research ahead of time and see if there is a nearby gym. Despite a great location, I wouldn't choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AKMicaiah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and updated. The rooms were cleaned daily for the most part. The location is great. The only issue I had with the hotel was the service. The staff is not helpful or friendly. They practally hang up on you if you call with a question and act like you are in their way if you approach the desk for anything. For the price you pay for a room the poor service is unexceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Scrupulously Clean and Stellar Service”
Reviews.Author: caborio334
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for over a month while accompanying my husband on business and we enjoyed every minute of it! This is an extremely clean hotel throughout and the rooms are in like new condition as the hotel is only a year old. The kitchenette in the room included a full size fridge, a mini-dishwasher, a full size sink, a full size coffee maker, and an electric cooktop (no oven). The overall soundproofing of the rooms was above average, the beds and bedding were exceptionally comfortable, and the free breakfast buffet was a delicious value. The laundromat area could be a bit larger--there are 4 washers and 4 dryers for over 200 guest rooms--but it was a much appreciated convenience having a clean and bright laundry in the hotel. The pool is definitely lacking here--it is very small, more like an oversized spa--and it is only 3 feet deep. The exercise facility was adequate; however, be advised that skilled photography on the website makes the gym appear larger than it actually is. There are 4 pieces of cardio equipment but only a tiny weight bench with a few dumbells. As an avid gym-goer, I got around this issue by joining a 24 Hour Fitness facility in Horton Plaza, about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The staff at The Residence Inn were truly professional and always courteous. It was a pleasure dealing with each and every employee here! Valet parking is mandatory (and expensive at $32/night), however, the valets were extremely prompt, polite, and attentive--on some occasions, they literally RAN to open the lobby doors for us. The dining room staff is extremely efficient and friendly as are the front desk and housekeeping staff. In addition, the maintenance department is equally attentive; I broke a coffee carafe and in under 5 minutes, a maintenance worker had removed the broken glass and thoroughly swept and vacuumed the room! The service here is truly exemplary. The location, in the Gaslamp area of downtown, is a vibrant, exciting one. There are scores of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance, and although the area draws a young crowd of party-goers, we never heard any street noise inside of the hotel. I loved staying at the Residence Inn Gaslamp, and despite a few minor drawbacks, would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: 818cj
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed my stay. There were a few things that I didn't like such as the male individual who checked me in. All other personal were very helpful and went the extra mile to make me comfortable. The two other minor bumps were the bath tub drain plug didn't hold the water and one of the blinds didn't retract up. Overall it was a good visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lousy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JMNap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The location is walking distance to some great restaurants and bars. Parking in downtown San Diego can be difficult at best, especially on the weekends, so this is a real plus even though you will pay $32 a night to park your car at this hotel. The rooms are clean and updated. There isn't much room around the bathroom sink to put your essentials, especially for two people, but we only stayed for one night. The free breakfast they offer is ok. If you are looking for someting nice, it's probably better to walk across the street or up the block for some other options. We stayed over Valentine's Day weekend. My husband made arrangements with this hotel to have flowers delivered to our room for me. They weren't there when we arrived, but he thought maybe the flowers would be brought later after we got back from dinner. No flowers ever showed up. So when we checked out the next day my husband checked at the front desk about the flowers and apparently they had been in a side office since the day before. Nobody knew why they weren't taken up to us. The flowers had our name on them. Also, we had called down to the front desk to have someone come up and assist us with our luggage, we also contacted valet to have our car brought to the front so that we could leave.
