Our car made it. Nobody ever showed up to get our luggage after we waited 30 minutes. So we decided to bring our luggage down ourselves. When when got down to our car we told the valet we were sorry our car had to sit so long, we told him we had been waiting for a half hour for help. He said he was sorry but he was unaware of anyone from the front desk contacting them for luggage assistance. So from our experience, don't depend on the front desk for anything, especially if it is important. The funny thing is when we left it wasn't even busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: kurtprough
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Cheerful, helpful staff, clean, well appointed, and in the absolute perfect spot. It is within walking distance to everything in downtown San Diego. It is right next door to PetCo park. As a Marriott Platnium member, I can say this is a great hotel and highly recommend it, just make sure to leave me a room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgal63
Reviews.Content: Three of us in the suite. Very roomy and the bed very comfy. Pull out couch was fairly comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The location is great for the Gaslamp area. Pool area is small but we used it along with the fitness area which was small but had a fun view of the street below. I liked the decor and the sliding shoji screen between the living/bedroom areas is a great space saver. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sdprairiegirl
Reviews.Content: We had a King Suite with a pak-n-play for our 2.5 year old. The kitchen was awesome. Other reviewers warned it was smaller than expected, but it had a full-size frig, micro, stove, toaster, dishes, etc. Really awesome for eating in the room. We like the layout of the rooms, too. It felt roomy, but had a good-size sofa, two-person dining table, coffee table. The bedroom was great - a little light on the drawers, but not many people unpack, anyway. Bathroom was nice, too. Everything was impeccably clean and the housekeeping staff was awesome. We have rarely been to a hotel where the staff seems so eager to be helpful. We made a request for a foam pillow - it was there in minutes! Other hotels, I'm lucky to get it by that night. We used the laundry facilities regularly, since we're potty training. They were clean and an awesome feature. We also liked being in the Gaslamp district. We were one block off 5th, where all the action is, but that was actually better. We had a dozen restaurants to choose from in a few blocks. And with a 2-yr-old, having options is a good thing. The valet parking was the best I've had at a hotel. Other valet experiences I've had, you had to give the valet a good 15-20 minutes lead time before you actually wanted the car. We would call down on the way to the elevator, and the car was already sitting on the curb every time. It was impressive. Overall, we loved this hotel, would definitely recommend it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: CABeachlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. There is no restaurant on site, but they do have carry out available that you can take to your room; however, the menu is limited. Staff was very helpful about local attractions, restaurants, etc. Centrally located to things downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family with kids - and for food allergy travelers”
Reviews.Author: datogaisland
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and the rooms were clean, the service was fast, and the in-room kitchen allowed us to provide for our child with food allergies by cooking our own food, which also saved us money when we didn't feel like eating out. We had called ahead and asked for a room cleaned without strong chemicals and there was virtually no 'typical hotel' smell when we walked in. The hotel's location provides multiple grocery and supply options within walking distance including CVS, Ralph's supermarket, and Cine mini mart (convenience store). The only parking is valet at $32 per day but you can just call from your room and the car is down there when you get down making it a very convenient option for loading/unloading kids. Anything we asked the front desk for (extra towels, pillows) was delivered within 10 minutes. The front desk and valet personnel were very helpful and would give you a pedestrian map with highlighted directions every time you asked for a specific type of destination close by. The free breakfast was great with ample sitting room and the takeout option was helpful as well. Given the hotel is less than 2 years old I wasn't surprised by the chic decor and fast elevators. The restaurants within walking distance were great as well. Mexican, Indian, Chinese, Italian and American establishments in Gaslamp quarter offer a variety of delicious options including vegetarian. The hotel is a short drive from the 5 freeway for day trips up to Legoland and Los Angeles. It takes 7 minutes to get to the airport and the same for Balboa Park which houses San Diego Zoo and other great museums and activities for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: MaineWeekender
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn was perfect for our trip that started out as a business conference in San Diego, and ended with a vacation tour of CA. The Inn was renovated not long ago and looks nice. It's a 5 minute, 2-block walk from the conference center, or about 15 minutes' walk to Seaport Village. Ask for a map at the front desk. it's a big help finding your way around. The front desk people are always nice. You need your room key to use the elevator. Our room on nearly the top floor was beautifully clean, spacious, quiet, and had a great view looking north towards 5th Avenue. If you can get a high floor room looking west towards the water, that's awesome. The kitchenette is perfect, having a full size refrigerator, lots of counter and cabinet space, a cooking surface, coffee maker, dishwasher, paper towels, plus all the dishes, silverware and cookpots you might need. You can buy groceries at Ralph's, a 15 minute walk, or you can take a bus or taxi to the Trader Joe's farther north. Better yet, take advantage of the hotel's free grocery-stocking service. Check the info sheet in your kitchenette for details or ask at the front desk. There is a small dining table in the kitchen, plus the usual coffee table and desk in the living area. The bathroom door was opaque and on sliding overhead rails, like a barn door. You definitely can't see through it, but if you're very shy it might bother you. What I liked less was the dressing/sink area between the bath and bed --- there's a huge clothes armoire up against the wall and a tall sink/counter cabinet standing between the kitchen and bath area facing the armoire, so that when you're trying to wash up or dress there the other person/people can't get to the bathroom easily. (The Residence Inn in Salinas has the perfect floorplan). The bed was totally comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud. The free breakfast in the breakfast room on the 2nd floor was tremendous -- tons of choices, lots of seating, nice atmosphere. If something needs to be restocked, just ask, and the food service people will help you. You won't need or want a car while attending a conference, but there is a parking lot right across the street from the hotel, north on Sixth Avenue. The prices are extremely reasonable there. I think we paid $18 to park from one afternoon through to the next day at noontime or so. A signboard out front has the prices. We used the kitchenette daily as the Gaslamp restaurants are not only astronomically expensive but also serve nothing but fatty, greasy stuff typical of tourist traps. There is no 'healthy California food" here unless you buy the groceries yourself. By way of comparison, Chicago is far less expensive and the food is worlds better. On our last day in San Diego we went to Balboa Park and found Prado Restaurant, which was fabulous!!! Great food, great service. Well worth the trip out there. Hub Market, a few blocks north of the hotel on 748 Sixth, serves a very decent sandwich, side dish and drink for around $7.50. Freshly made and delicious, this sandwich was far superior to the meal we got at the only vegetarian restaurant listed for this area. Beware the Toscana cafe about a block west of this Residence Inn. They'll serve you about 50 cents worth of spaghetti with a spoonful of tomato sauce for $19. In sum: the Residence Inn Gaslamp offered extremely clean, comfortable, modern rooms with great service and free breakfast for a reasonable price. The ability to prepare your own meals is a huge money-saving plus. It is also within easy walking distance of the conference center, Seaport Village, and other lovely areas and has both valet parking and a reasonably priced parking lot next door. Next time we're in San Diego for a conference, we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good location, good service and good price”
Reviews.Author: lov3totrav3l
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a room in the Gas Lamp district. I have no complaints with the hotel, the rooms are nice and big, the staff is very helpful and is right in the middle of the Gas Lamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, glad I picked it.”
Reviews.Author: travellingtuba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights while I was attending a conference at the Convention Center in December. I am really glad that I chose this hotel, as opposed to the designated conference hotels (Omni, Hyatt, ginormous Marriott). I got a reasonable rate for the area, which I was glad included breakfast and free internet, since my conference breakfast left much to be desired... Anyways. I stayed in a king suite, which was a great corner room with 2 different views of the city (stay on higher floors for better views-- I was on the 11th). I was impressed by the tiny, yet full kitchen with quite modern, stainless steel appliances, including a dishwasher. My only complaint is that the burners on the stove are really close together, so two big pans don't fit at the same time. Oh well. No oven, either, but I don't think most people would need one. The decor was modern and very clean, and I liked the layout of the room: a studio, but the kitchen was around the corner from the living/sleeping area. There is a vanity that serves as a half wall between the kitchen area and the bathroom, and the bathroom was very spacious. My only complaint with that was the lack of lotion, which of course, I had forgotten at home. The daily free appetizers down in the lobby were really nice, and one could fill up on them as dinner if you so chose. The bar looked nice, but I didn't partake. Breakfast was basic but good, and there seemed to be enough space to sit, unlike many other Residence Inns I've been to. The location of the hotel is perfect: enough off of the beaten path so that it's a little private, but within walking distance of tons of restaurants, shops, bars, public transportation and the convention center. The fitness center is pretty tiny, so you might have to wait to use the equipment if it were a busy time. The equipment was nice, though. I also liked having valet services outside, and you had to use your key to access the elevator. Both made me feel just a bit safer, as I was traveling alone. Overall, I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone else, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational service and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Distinctivetraveller
Reviews.Content: I had the most incredible experience. I stayed at this very nice hotel: clean, modern and functional. What was amazing was that I encountered an employee that went out of his way completely to help. I called down to get a suit pressed in the evening and John from front desk answered. As I described the situation (needed suit pressed in the evening for an early morning meeting), he said he would take care of it immediately. And I did not know it then, but he meant it literally. Afterwards, when I checked out, I learned from his colleague that even though the service was not available (it was late when I asked for it), he took it upon himself to iron it in the back office! Wow, I was so impressed that he had not even mentioned anything (he was not expecting anything, just giving the service to a customer). If I would of known, I would of probably told him not to worry about it, but I was impressed to learn of this incredible gesture on his part. It would of been as easy as to say "service not available at this time", but he did it with no expectation of any sorts. I hope he becomes EMPLOYEE OF THE YEAR for Marriott as a whole. Impressive!!!! I will return again just to say hello to this fantastic employee. The hotel is excellent, but the service is impressive....much has to do with management at this property, I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay at the Residence Inn with a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: littleface6
Reviews.Content: We checked in October 29th for 5 nights. Husband had a convention at the conference center and this a very quick 5 minute walk away! We were given room 805 which is a lovely corner unit so you have 4 windows to look out. I had read reviews and knew not to be to low or on the top to floors....well - all I can say is ANYWHERE you stay in the gaslamp disrict will be noisy! Firetrucks, police cars, partying etc! What I felt like the Residence Inn did a TERRIBLE job of was informing the guests of a Halloween multi block outdoor party. The streets around us were closed of and from around 2:30 pm in the afternoon on October 30th until 3 am - Sunday October 31st - our whole room vibrated! We could see the stage of this massive event out our window....I called down to see about ear plugs - you could hear it in the shower it was so loud as the night went on - vibrating bed (at no extra cost!) Eric at the front desk was downright rude when I called to question them and ask to have a manager call me the next day....no one called me at all. Eric did not appoligize, just said if you stay in the gaslamp district, expect partying...well that's fine if you know what to expect but the prices had gone up $150 from a Friday night stay to a Saturday night because of this convention in town which was for cancer and they could have given their guests a heads up. You could hear the police officers blowing their whistles to direct traffic for hours! Yes - Valet is the parking they have...I always called down and they had it ready for us - very nice New Hotel-our room was kept very clean - beds are a little on the hard side! One thing to note is that the bedroom door is sliding with a frosted glass so it really is hard to have someone with a light on in the living room or bedroom with out it bothering the other. This same concept for the bathroom....we had to exit the bedroom, walk past the couch with someone sleeping on it, past the small table with 2 chairs, chest to hang clothes in, and sink (outside of bathroom) to get to the bathroom - another sliding frosted door. The bathroom was plenty large so a fan is not needed. Just plan on not much storage space! You will need to use your suitcase some....there is room for a chest in the bedroom but it's not there! I really couldn't believe the 2 nightstands....all the reviews are so right....you can not open them all the way so...there are only able to be opened 3-4 inches! CRAZY - so....2 nightstand with 3 drawers each.....nothing else in bedroom, chest by sink - to hang up and 2 small drawers - that's it! Hardly any kitchen space- Had to put most everything on counter - SO nice to have a full fridge, microwave & stove top! There is a big plasma tv in bedroom and another one on the wall in the living room....same wall on opposite side so...you really could not use them both at the same time! Pool is a JOKE! it is about 16 feet x 16 feet and the maximum occupancy is 11! Really! It's in a blocked off area with no view so don't stay here is you would like a pool - lots of better options around the area - The breakfast was good and they had 1 or two different choices every day. No, they did not always have a seat available but...there were many more seats here than at most Residence Inn's and because it is new...a little more modern. There was always: scrambled eggs, a meat, fresh fruit, waffle maker, cereal, yoguart, milk, oatmeal, juice, and potatoe, muffins, english muffins, salsa....they rotated the meat and potatoe item on each of the days we were there. If they ran out of something....I would just ask and they got it. Having 2 boys with me, this was excellent way to get breakfast in! Monday and Tuesday night they had a manager's reception. One had much more variety than the other but....for a little munchies, treat and soda...it was nice to have something. So....with 2 major Halloween Party nights happening in downtown it was a little hard to have sleep but - overall, the hotel was good. We had friends at other hotels in gaslamp and they heard the noise as well. Just decide what you want the hotel for and go with that! San Diego is wonderful! So much to do!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Except for the Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Bizmarkky
Reviews.Content: My pregnant wife and infant daughter stayed in a one bedroom suite for two nights. The first night was uneventful. However, on the second night I slept on the pullout sofa because my wife was feeling some discomfort and I wanted to give her plenty of room. To my surprise, I woke up and found my arms and back covered with insect bites. I assumed they were bedbugs and alerted management. The person at the front desk told me that it was probably fleas from a guest that had a pet in the room. It seems as though the word "bedbug" is taboo in the industry now. Either way, she offered me $50 or some Marriott reward points. I politely declined and she directed me to her manager who was not on duty for further compensation. I never spoke to the manager but someone from Marriott corporate did get in touch with me to "settle my claim." Apparently someone from legal called me rather than someone from customer service. In any case, I agree with all of the other reviews. I would definitely stay at this place if I could be assured of a bedbug free experience. Sadly, if it's in one room, they are probably in more.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: aylur
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night here and must say, it is a very good place. Lovely rooms, great exercise facility, dependable WIFI and right in Gas Lamp quarter- walking around is easy and staff are friendly. We were booked on 14th floor and view from our room was good. The lay out of the bathroom was neat and for the first time happened to see a shower cubicle in a Residence Inn- way to go!!

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest hotel with the best service and value”
Reviews.Author: Brewster68922
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the curb and all the hotel staff made a point of greeting us each time we were seen. The rooms were modern with a small kitchen. The Gas Lamp area has tons of places to eat and find entertainment. Check out the piano bar Shout if you get the chance. I think I liked the location, close to the convention center, places to eat, and places to be entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but thieves working Housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: jsc310
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel and have had a wonderful experience so far with one exception. I awoke this morning and went to start my Ipod for some music and couldnt find it. I went through all of my belongings and the entire room and no luck. I am absolutely positive that my Ipod was next to my computer with its cord (which is still here) but it has mysteriously disappeared. To top it off, I left a note in my room asking for my Ipod to be returned and when i got back tonight the note had been removed and still no Ipod. The only people other than myself that have entered my room are housekeeping. When I called the front desk they said nothing other than that they would follow up with housekeeping. I am not one to point fingers, but I do not like being robbed. If you decide to stay here make sure you hide your valuables.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is new, so obviously the...”
Reviews.Author: yamahakc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, so obviously the cleanliness and accomodations are great. For the first time...EVER... It was the service staff that made it memorable, specifically the breakfast attendants. It has been my experience that service staff that work the early morning shifts in hotels are generally grumpy and could care less about the customers... Definately not true at this hotel! They made breakfast a joy... They were engaging, remembered us and made our stay FUN! Kudos gals (and guy) for reinventing your position. We just had to get a pic of them to include in our photos of the trip... And they took a great pic (posing with our travel mascot)... A picture speaks a thousand words and you can just see that they work well as a team and have turned a generally unpleasant job into a VERY important part of the whole hotel experience. Keep this group together and your success is inevitable... Again thumbs up from KC--- Jared/Kathi/Limo , and of course Sparkey the Travel Shark

Reviews.Title: “New property, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days attending a conference. It's a new property 10mins walk to conference center, in heart of Gaslamp district, one block from 5th Avenue where most restaurants are located, 5 mins to Petco Park, and felt safe walking around this area at night. CVS is 2 blocks away, Ralph's for groceries 7 blocks. All the staff I met were friendly, efficient and helpful. Mona at the frontdesk was outstanding. It's an all-suite hotel, each suite with a fully equipped kitchenette, free fast in-room WiFi, 2 widescreen TVs, comfy sofa, but no baths. Hotel Salomar across the road is noisy on sat nites, but it wasn't too bad when I was there and I wasn't bothered. Breakfast is included but basic. Head across the road to Broken Yolk for a good breakfast. Coin laundry is also available in hotel. Overall, thumbs up, congratulations to all the staff for making my stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish, Friendly..... and TINY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kalifornia77
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at this hotel during Comic-Con as it was the closest hotel we could find to the convention center that wasnt sold out. All i can say is, do NOT believe what you see in the photos on the website! We were in utter and total shock when we walked into our room and saw the size of it. The "full kitchen" is literally 5 feet long with a dishwasher, fridge, microwave, and 2-burner electric cooktop all wedged into a tiny corner of the room. Well I immediately called the front desk to confirm that this was the room seen on the webstite that i had booked. What i was told was, Every room is the exact same sq footage but some are laid out different than others. The room was very clean and well kept, and the staff was very friendly but we simply couldnt get over the size of the room. It looks NOTHING like the pictures online. Here were some of the more strange and confusing things about the room and the hotel in general: THE BAD 1) There was no sink in the bathroom!?!? The sink and counter is setup outside the bathroom right next to the bed. Great, the last thing i wanna see is other people washing up, brushing their teeth and shaving. 2) No vent in the bathroom!?!? First time ever i have seen a hotel bathroom with no vent system whatsoever. 3) The hotel pool maxed out a 3.5' deep!?!? For a hotel this size how do you not have a pool where the water level comes above adults waists?? 4) The hotel resteraunt and bar. OK im used to paying huge overblown prices for small portions, i mean it is a hotel resteraunt, but when my buddy spent $15 for 4 buffalo wings and 10 french fries, i was kind of shocked. Also the resteraunt/bar area is like the room, tiny! On the website they make the resteraunt look huge and the bar look like a seperate area for drinking, its not and its not. 5) The elevators. I dont know if this is a new trend in hotels but you have to swipe your room card in the elevator panel everytime you want to use it....EVERY TIME. Gets very old when your going in and out a lot. THE GOOD 1) Hotel and room were sparkling clean and updated with new carpet, fixtures and very stylish decor. 2) Staff was very friendly and helpfull. 3) There was a free breakfast every morning, but i didnt have a chance to get at it, but the area they served it in looked very cozy. Overall, clean, friendly, but way too small for the money. Theres no way id reccomend a family of four staying in a room that tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: ImurDaddysGirl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here with my step daughter to do all the typical "tourist trappings" (SeaWorld, Zoo, etc). The location was perfect! Sizable rooms (ours had the available pull out sofa), full kitchen will free grocery delivery, terrific breakfast included in room price. Only real "complaint" is the very high cost of valet. But in comparison to the parking lot across the street, for the service provided, it was more than worth the extra few bucks it cost to "self park" over there. I watched the price fluctuate between $5 during the day to $25 at night and dont even THINK about it if there is a ballgame in town. We came back one evening to find overwhelming traffic and unusually large crowd because the Dodgers/Padres game had just let out. Another suggestion to the valets might be to "become friendly" with some of the many pedicabs that are available in that area. We decided one evening to make reservations for the Melting Pot restaurant that was closeby (about a mile) Although not really handicapped, I have difficulty walking sometimes and would have been really grateful if they would have been able to "summon" one of these "cabs" to take us to our restaurant. There was no need to drag our vehicle out for such a short drive and parking would have been a nightmare in that area anyway so we decided to walk. There are numerous things to do within walking distance (less than a mile) of this hotel. From first rate restaurants to movie theaters, chocolate shoppes to nightclubs. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: juljayw
Reviews.Content: I loved staying a week in this hotel. My Husband needed to attend a seminar for a 5 day period so my 6 year old and I tagged along. The Hotel breakfast had a great variety of foods for my picky child and were very attentive to make sure we had what we needed. The best part was the customer service. I spent an afternoon at La Jolla Cove (13 miles away) with my son and I fell and cut open my leg. Not knowing the area, I returned to the hotel to tend to the wound but my first aid kit has been destroyed during my unplanned fall into the ocean (hence the cut). The valet noticed it first and asked what he could do to help. He helped me into the hotel where the front staff took over and found us bandages and antibiotic ointment. They were very sweet and soothed my 6 year old who was worried. The room was nice and accommodated the 3 of us but I would recommend the upgrade if you have more than two. We were slightly cramped and privacy was an issue. Our only issue was there is no room service and the rooms have no movie service . That would have made the stay perfect. Walking distance to seaport village.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Contemporary, and in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: Marcello74
Reviews.Content: Booked a king one-room suite for my wife and I, as she joined me in town for a post-convention vacation. Despite my request for a higher floor, we ended up on the third floor, and since the hotel was booked full, we had to stick with the room for the first night. Room(s) are not massive, but space enough for two people to survive a week. The building has some nice features to remind visitors of its history - including exposed brick at reception, and sliding "barn-style" frosted glass doors in rooms. Ultra cool. The only issue is that such a door doesn't allow for much privacy when it's between the bedroom and the bathroom. Our first room was a king with a full bathroom (including small tub/shower) and pull out sofa, as well as kitchen. When we finally got moved to a higher floor on our second night (I had to pull some attitude with front desk, who maintained that the hotel was still "very full"...though in the end, it turned out there were several other rooms available) we were downgraded to a queen bed -- still with pull-out sofa, full kitchen. Our bathroom had a glass and tile shower, though, and no tub. This was fine -- the shower was spacious. Noise from hallways was an issue -- the elevators chime very loudly, and voices of other guests seem to travel right in to the room. When tucked away into the bedroom with the sliding door shut, it wasn't an issue. The kitchen is fully stocked. I was a bit wary of the housekeeping staff replacing used glasses in cupboards, as we knew they weren't going through the dishwasher in our suite. (Hopefully the new glassware came off a cart, and wasn't just wiped and replaced!) Overall, the suite was well-cleaned each day, though the couches in both rooms we had were already fairly grimy. Our shower door leaked a lot of water, but since housekeeping was so good at replacing towels, we just mopped up as we went. Our only issue was not being able to open a window -- long term stays in hotels can make one claustrophobic. An opening window would have been nice...but obviously that's just not possible the way things were built. The free breakfast is a bit of a zoo -- this is a family hotel, and as such, the eating area is over-run with families of all sizes. Still, the food is varied and healthy options are available. Staff work really hard to clear tables and meet the demands of even the rudest guests -- and should be commended for keeping a smile on their faces! Pool itself is small, but the roof top terrace it's on offers a relaxing space to lounge in the hot SoCal sun. Didn't use the fitness room, but loved its location looking down on busy 5th Avenue. Laundry facilities were a most welcome thing as I was travelling over 12 days in total. Free internet was a great perk. Lobby was large, with seating for several groups, a business centre of sorts, and a bar/resto around the corner. The mini-shop in the lobby was handy though priced high. Parking may be priced a bit steep, but the valet guys were amazing at fetching cars and hailing cabs. Overall, this hotel is a relatively cool and fairly reasonable option for staying in the Gaslamp District. Far enough away from train tracks as to avoid those midnight blaring cargo trains, but still in thr heart of the busy and noisy bar/restaurant zone of the Gaslamp. Ask for a higher floor to help with the weekend noise, if you're sensitive to that. Given its popularity and proximity to the convention centre and Gaslamp district, though, you may not be given much choice!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Henleyco
Reviews.Content: Property may be new but they have not spent anytime with customer service. I was basically told, when I complained that the room I was given was not the room type I requested, that they had lots of people that wanted the room (due to a major city wide convention) so either like it or leave it. Front desk has no authority to make any concessions to try to rectify a situation and continued to say that they are very busy so there was nothing they could do. For a premium price, I am amazed that this is the level of customer service and will not recommend the property to future clients.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, great location. Full kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: detjason
Reviews.Content: I think that really nice hotels like this Residence Inn get nitpicked by reviewers in an attempt to find something to complain about. While some of the complaints in the previous reviews are accurate (parking fee, long lines for breakfast), many are trivial when you take into consideration the many amenities at this hotel. At the end of this review, I address some of the complaints from previous reviewers as well as add some of my own pet peeves. We stayed here for one week over 4th of July weekend. It is important to note that there are two types of rooms, a studio suite and a 1BR suite. The 1BR is larger and has a divider between the living area and the bed. I am pretty sure you can either have 1 queen or 1 king, but there are no double beds. Some suites have sofa beds, some do not. If you need one, make sure you reserve one. We stayed in the smaller studio suite and found it suitable for 2 adults and a small child. The full kitchen is only missing a traditional oven, but has a full refrigerator, microwave, electric range, pots, pans, silverware and cooking utensils. This was a big advantage for us during our week stay. The location is â€œas good as it getsâ€� for Gaslamp. If you arenâ€™t familiar with this area, it is the busiest part of downtown with the most shopping and restaurants. However, it isnâ€™t Rodeo Drive. This is "downtown" so you will see plenty of homeless people and drunk rowdy young adults on most nights, especially weekends. Many of the restaurants and bars cater to the party crowds as there are drink specials and happy hours galore. But there are also many high-end and fancy restaurants and others that accommodate families too. The location is within walking distance are the convention center, Padres Petco Park, Seaport Village, Horton Plaza, and the train station. 3 minutes to the zoo. When we arrived on Thursday night at 9:00 PM, there was a guest complaining about a music concert outside. Although the concert was over a block away, we could here it on the 10th floor. Fortunately, it stopped at 9:30 PM before we went to sleep. We didnâ€™t have any other city noise issues for the week. As previously reviewed, the hotel is very clean and very new. The decor and ambiance is really modern and the lobby/lounge area has many places to sit and relax or enjoy a drink. There is also a large communal table in the lobby where there are outlets to plug in your laptop and enjoy the free Internet. The small market has drinks, beer, wine, ice cream, snacks and other sundries. One interesting thing about this hotel is that they donâ€™t offer "Do Not Disturb" signs for your door. At first, I was sure that there was some high-tech way that house keeping could detect the room was occupied when locked from the inside. No such luck. After being awaken by housekeeping twice, I realized the inside lock only prevents them from unlocking the door, not from knocking on it. I guess I could have requested a sign. I believe all Residence Inns allow pets. I was the lucky guest who was woken up 4th of July morning at zero-dark-thirty by two large barking dogs next door. Their owner had gone for a jog and left them to howl for 30 minutes. After I complained to the front desk and the owner, I never heard them again. Another pet peeve (pun intended) of mine are slamming hotel doors. I realize the doors must be self-closing for fire safety, but I refuse to believe that they have to close so violently that they rattle the halls. The doors at this new Residence Inn get the "Best in Show" award for the loudest slamming doors in their class. I wish guests had the common sense to hold the door as it closes to prevent their neighbors from thinking we were having an after-shock of the latest California earthquake. Previous reviews complain about the parking fee and it also gave me pause. But I learned that all of downtown is overpriced parking. Many hotels in this area are close to $30/day and the parking lots are $18 to $25. I figured it was worth the price of valet and was very pleased with the valet service. Even when there were several people waiting for their car, it never took more than 5 minutes. I justified the expense by figuring out I save $30/day with the free breakfast the hotel serves as well as free Internet. We only found long lines for breakfast on Sunday morning (4th of July) of our week stay. This seems to only occur in the last hour of breakfast. Despite the final hour chaos, the hotel has at least 4 employees running around cleaning tables, bringing out more food and coffee. However, we found a place to sit even on Sunday. Taking the food back to your room was also a nice alternative. For the reviewers who thought that there was insufficient lighting to shave or put on make-up in front of the mirror in the morning; open the curtains and let the abundance of sunlight in. Iâ€™m sorry one reviewer didnâ€™t think nine dresser drawers and an armoire were enough storage space. Yes, some drawers only pull out half-way to prevent tipping, but they are full sized drawers. You just have to put one or two items of clothing in at a time instead of a stack. For the reviewers who complained that the vanity/sink is outside of the bathroom and that the tub and shower are one unit instead of separate: Clearly, the sink is outside of the bathroom for the sake of efficiency so that one person isnâ€™t dominating all three at once. As for separating the tub and shower: Marriott is trying to do as much as it can with a limited space per room both to make it efficient for extended-stay travelers and keep costs to the consumer down. Remember that full kitchen you get? That is where your separate tub was supposed to go.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place For Family and/or Large Group”
Reviews.Author: honeyloveca
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times with family and friends...and will continue to return. The location is walking distance to the heart of the Gaslamp restaurants, pubs, clubs and stores. The room is spacious and complete, like your own studio apartment. The price definitely is a bargain for all the amenities and accommodations that are offered to guests. Breakfast buffet had everything and was completely satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LJVC
Reviews.Content: We have fully enjoyed this Residence Inn and the service has been outstanding. Upon arriving in our room, we could hear the jackhammering going on outside our window. We immediately call the front desk who offered to move us to another room. They then met us at our original room and walked us up to a higher floor and one on the opposite side of the jack hammering. We were told there was construction going on and they apologized. We have valeted our car (even at the high price of $32/night) and the valet staff has been outstanding. We hardly waited at all for the car to be pulled up. The room has been nice also. Only wish there was a desk and a speaker phone but otherwise, it has been very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for family with 2 teens.”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVirginian
Reviews.Content: My employer registered us here for a five-day business trip on which my wife and two teenage boys accompanied me to enjoy San Diego while I worked. While very nice, the two-room suite was too small for us, and we were able to move after two nights to the more spacious rooms at Embassy Suites. The problem was that all rooms in this hotel contain only one double bed and a small pullout sofa that's barely big enough for one person, let alone two people. This might work for a family with two small children, but not for two big teenagers. Also, they were aghast at the tiny pool, no bigger than a small room and only 3 feet deep everywhere. The two rooms were small, although the suite had a fully equipped kitchen. They serve a free breakfast every morning, and are in a great location. A very nice hotel, but best suited to no more than two adults and a child.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate stay in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: dozygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Gaslamp quarter for a conference at the Convention Centre for 4 nights. The room we were given was on the 7th flor and overlooked the pool area. We could see the gym and people working out from our window- seems well utilised. The pool was small though. We also had glimpses of the sea and watched to sunset, sort of! The room was large and clean with a king bed and had a small kitchenette with a a dish washer, microwave and cook top which would be convenient when travelling with children. There was a full size fridge. The basin was outside the bathroom, which is a bit unusual but this gives the flexibility fo using this when the bathroom is occupied! I'd seen this at Mira Hong Kong as well. Shower was over the bath- ok but given how new the hotel was, thought it a bit passe. Water pressure of shower was good. Breakfast was fine, There was a waffle machine, cereal, porridge, scrambled eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, pastries. The breakfast area is a bit small though, I can see how it fills up quickly. There were people filling up plates and taking them back to their rooms. Wired internet in room was complimentary. I had no trouble with the service. The reception staff were helpful with maps of the area and direction to restaurants. When I was looking a little lost in the foyer, someone from reception came up and asked if they could help. OVerall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: Mev1991
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Ah yes, April 14th, a full month prior to arrival when I made our reservation and paid for the entire 3 night stay UP FRONT via the ADVANCE PURCHASE RATE directly through Marriott's site onto my credit card. Stated very clearly on the reservation is "LATE CHECK-IN" as my husband and I, along with our 3 y/o would be driving from Disneyland. Guess what happened? Yup, finally made it to the hotel and was told that our room was "sold away". Huh? How can this be? It is already paid for, thus already mine. At 9:46pm (as per my cell phone statement) I called the desk to remind them that we would be late and are coming form Disney. I was told that my room was waiting for us and that my request for a sofa bed for my toddler would be honored. At 10:45pm I called again to report that we were lost, but that we were still coming. This time the same clerk stated that there were only 8 rooms left and to hurry. I reminded her that I had a reservation, and she just reiterated to "hurry". At 12 o'clock at night, our super-tired family was ushered across the street to another Marriott, told that the room would be compt'd (I'd certainly hope so) and to pack up all our stuff and return the following morning. Again, whaaaaat?!?! So we go across the street like the Griswalds amid a bustling lobby filled with clubbers and ask for our room key. The room was fine, but lacked the kitchenette we reserved with the Residence Inn for all the food supplies we had stopped to buy on the way. Had to toss all perisables. And this other hotel didn't offer the free breakfast like the Residence Inn, either. The next morning, called the desk at Residence Inn. The manager on-duty was very nice and knew who we were and said to come anytime as our room was ready. Got over about 11am and being from EST, were starving for breakfast and mentioned how we missed out. Promptly given a $25 credit and a 10% coupon for the Broken Yolk restaurant across the way. That was the only discount given for the hassle from the night before. And the 10% coupon is given to any guest that asks. Only got the $25 credit because I complained. And the super-nice corner room they supposidely upgraded us to? Well, my brother and his gf happened to be staying there with us, and they got a corner room. So much for the upgrade. They got there from Disney just before us. NICE. Had to stay in a different hotel from my family. I mentioned how I was not satified and asked if the $32 a night valet fee could be taken care of. "No" was the answer. Nothing more was done to try to make us happy, so here is your warning. Later, I went to the desk looking for the clerk that said my room was still available the night before. Kelly appears and seems nervous. When asked how on Earth she could give our room away even after talking to her twice prior to arriving, she first blamed the guy that replaced her shift for the night, then said that on busy evenings it becomes "first come, first serve". Again, WHAAAAAATTTTT?!?! Then why bother making a reservation? She had no answer. I left the desk uphappy once again. Upon check-out, I had given up on trying to get some satisfaction, a discount, somethng other that $25 for a breakfast we missed out on, not to mention the food we had to throw away. The lady at the desk was different, given in was now Monday and asked the usual, "How was your stay" question. Mistake. BIG MISTAKE. Quickly went though the events that had happened upon arrival, and went so far as to mention how we were still not happy. Strike Three....nothing more was done and the general manager's business card was requested. Right after this review is posted, the letter to the GM is getting written. UNBELIEVABLE. The hotel is very nice, new hotel and turned out to be where all the families were. This is a very busy downtown. Try not to go during a game as the Petco stadium is right around the corner. Double and triple check your reservation, just as I did, but understand that at this hotel, a reservation means ABSOLUTELY ZERO to the staff, especially on a busy night.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory Excursion”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTrekker
Reviews.Content: Our 15 May 2010 stay at the San Diego Downtown / Gaslamp Quarter Residence Inn is an unsatisfactory excursion, and as enthusiastic Marriott Rewards participants we are unhappily furnishing the following negative testimonial. DREADFULLY DISAPPOINTING: Although the king size bed and crisp lines are accommodating; comfort is absent because the mattress is exceedingly rigid and the pillows are not firm. Sleep-deprived best describes our excruciating un-restful experience. Management is unsympathetic and apathetic to our request to cancel, penalty free, a pre-paid reservation for next September. BENEATH EXPECTATIONS: Room, in general, is clean; we found a hair beret on the floor next to the sink. Bathroom is extremely small; toilet and shower (no tub) are co-located; with the sink vanity located in the sleeping area. Shower stall is scarcely sufficient to move around in. Roof top pool is small and the chairs and tables are limited even though the space will accommodate twice as many chairs and tables. No in-room safe; only safe deposit boxes at the front desk, which we did not use. Hotel only offers valet parking, which is an expensive $32 per night. MET EXPECTATIONS: Inviting front desk and lobby includes a two-way fireplace. Location is walking distances to many downtown activities and by private or public transportation only minutes away from numerous other attractions and landmarks. Check-in is a quick and effortless experience. Employees provide standard Marriott service; Kelly is sociable and exceptionally courteous. Room dÃ©cor is well appointed, and the neighboring occupants cannot be heard. Windows do not open; however, the panorama view of downtown is pleasing. San Diego bay is partially visible from the 9th floor. Television is 32â€� flat screen, mounted on the wall, with a decent cable/satellite channel selection that includes local channels, CNN, ESPN, Explorer, and HBO. However, noticeably missing from the choices are the Travel and Discover channels. Make sure to bring your portable DVD player or laptop; on the side of the television composite plug-ins are available. Sofa and overstuffed chair are comfortable for relaxing, reading, or watching television. Additional furnishings include small kitchen table, and coffee table; no desk. Medium closet contains three drawers, extra blanket and sheet and small ironing board with standard size iron. Individual climate control is simple to operate. Standard amenities, coffee and tea maker, alarm clock, and hair dryer are available. Breakfast is continental; muffins, bagels, fruit juices, fresh fruit, egg sandwiches â€“ with ham or bacon â€“ cereal, yogurt, milk, coffee, and waffles are made hot and fresh by the guest. Fitness Facilities include a reasonable amount of exercise machines. Express check out is uncomplicated. Building interior and exterior architecture is attractive. BEYOND EXPECTATIONS: Car valet is quick and first-rate; after calling ahead, we did not wait for our car as is customary. Dinning choices are abundant. Kitchenette amenities are ample and include dishwasher, stove, microwave, toaster, refrigerator, icemaker, pots, pans, serving dishes, and silverware. Exceptional: The brand new Residence Inn is a short walk to Petco Park, which are the two reasons we choose this hotel. INVOLVEMENT OR INSPECTION INADEQUATE TO INTERPRET: Evening and Managerâ€™s reception. Restaurant dinner delivery. Internet access. Laundry facilities. Pet accommodation. Vie; on-site bar.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: mountainmanAlberta
Reviews.Content: stayed their for 7 days for conference. great location to everything (covention center, gaslamp restuarants/bars, grocery store). i could not believe how friendly,polite,professinal everyone at the hotel is (from the doorman,frontdesk,restuarant staff, and even housekeeping). the best part was the daily HOT breakfast they served, not this continental garbage at other hotels. the room was large with modern kitchenette. came in handy to keep my drinks in the fridge and the leftover dinner from last night just use the microwave oven. i really like the modern decor. you can tell it's very new. the only downfall was the pool (quite small and on the 3rd floor-not much sunshine as you would like and very quiet) and the gym was very small as well. the hotel across the street had a pool on the top floor. now that's the way to do it, with a bar. the other concern was the valet parking, at $32 night, very steep. however, i'm sure other hotels were like that as well. if you rent a car, the best parking is in a car park, much cheaper. overall, awesome stay. had no problems with the hotel. hey, they even have free computer use if you needed to email someone but have no laptop. recommended for anyone to come here. best part was the breakfast, unless your just coffee person in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Places
Reviews.Content: We got great driving directions from the San Diego forum right here on TA to a brand new Residence Inn. Traffic was smooth since we reached SD around 2 pm. We parked in front of the hotel and unloaded our car. Our car was taken away by the valet service at a whooping price of $32.00 per day. Check in was smooth and we got the corner room on the eighth floor in the end of the hallway. This is a new hotel just opened and once again, like with a number of other newer Marriott's hotels, windows do not open. We had to leave a door opened for a while to get rid of smell of some cleaning stuff. Our suite consisted of a nice sized living room with a large flat TV and not very comfortable but usable sofa (why not sofabed?), big bathroom, bedroom with comfortable king bed and another flat screen TV. Because we were to spend there 6 days the most important for us was a kitchen with a stove top. No oven but that was fine with us for 6 days. We had plenty of windows on both sides but one flaw of this room was not much storage place. One armoire was small, had one shelf and half of it was taken by ironing board and other useless to us equipment. We were planning to keep some of our clothing in two night stands which had three drawers each. This was funny but the drawers did not open fully so another space wasted. We don't know who makes decision about furnishing for Marriott hotels but this new hotel with nice size rooms, in good location it didn't have any place to store clothes or any area in the kitchen to store food. So we kept food on the small counter and our clothes in our suitcases. The bathroom is big, has a large great shower with a bathtub but a sink is outside and the counter space almost nonexistent. No place to put anything besides toothpaste and toothbrushes. The sink is located in a dark corner and insufficient light for putting make up or shaving. We liked sliding screened doors between bedroom and living room and between living room and bathroom as long as we didn't have a company visiting us and using the bathroom. We should asked them to use it quietly, not willingly we learned a lot. Another big shortcoming is the breakfast area on the second floor. There are not enough tables to accommodate all guests. This hotel has 13 floors, so there are lots of people staying and it looks like the hotel was full and there were many kids and teenagers especially on weekend. I used exercise room which is very small and a pool is also small enough for splashing only. During six mornings we went for breakfast at different times and each time (except one) there were crowds, waiting for tables and food. The lines were long, the staff was very nice but couldn'tâ€™t keep up with refilling needed breakfast items. I ended up taking all we needed for breakfast upstairs to our room so we could eat in peace and quiet. Another thing, there are some night clubs in the area and on Saturday (or maybe it was Sunday) morning around 2 am there was lots of commotion, screaming, shouting, cars and more. Nonetheless, because our main reason for visiting SD was for my husband to attend the AAAS meeting we were pleased with staying at the Residence Inn which was a short walking distance from the convention center. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in this hotel again but for a shorter visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Gallerygirl_Aug08
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was close to where we wanted to be. The room was great. The bed was the best. I couldn't believe how comfortable it was. The staff was accomodating and friendly. They explained everything and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with my stay”
Reviews.Author: EAZELIFF
Reviews.Content: I was booked through Priceline and stayed at this three month old hotel. Excellent in almost all respects. The hotel room, while not what I would call lavish, was one of the best I have stayed in anywhere and was in pristine condition. I give out 5 stars for rooms sparingly, but this room rated. The staff was fine. My only criticism was that at breakfast on the third morning, the French toast and sausage were almost cold, and told the front desk about that. Fortunately, I had not driven to San Diego, so did not have that high parking fee. Even the dining room manager at the Solamar Hotel across the street ( where I stayed a year ago and is a hotel of which I think well of ) spoke glowingly of the new Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but very expensive parking fee”
Reviews.Author: yam1978
Reviews.Content: great location, walking distance to lots of things, nothing can beat that...although parking for $30 is really expensive, there is a parking lot for $5 a day behind PETCO park...another option good breakfast, included with your rate, comfortable beds bizarre thing about a room, we had a studio suite, and all residence inns i stayed at (and i stay at many) all have pull out sofas in studios with one bed...this one did not; we were travelling with friends, so some of us had to sleep on the floor...just something to consider if there are a few people staying in the room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central location with a hip appeal and enthusiastic staff”
Reviews.Author: hiptraveler_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a great location in the heart of the Gaslamp District walking distance to the ball park, convention center, and endless restaurants and bars. The architecture is great - a combination of all the modern amenities, but full of character at the same time. The staff is courteous and seemed genuinely happy to be working at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for access to San Diego Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: bluehawaii2003HD
Reviews.Content: This looks like a new hotel and is in a great location. Close enough to the Gas Lamp area and conference center to walk but, far enough away to keep things quiet. The breakfast is good and free. There is a nice place to eat right across the street if you want something better. Parking is expensive at $32 a day valet only so maybe best if your only doing business in downtown to catch a taxi to the hotel. The biggest issue I had with my room was the lighting for the sink. It's only on one side. For my room that was the right side. That made it hard to shave in the morning because of the lack of lighting. I'll try to post photos of what I was talking about for the sink later. Other wise this hotel is great to stay at. Has a kitchen to heat the left overs nice little area to workout in and people watch or have people watch you.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alinachka
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a â€œgirlâ€™s tripâ€� with my Mom (she was visiting me for my birthday from Chicago). The hotel is brand new â€“ I believe only about 3 months old (it still has a new smell to it). The lobby is really swanky and you wouldnâ€™t think you were at a Residence Inn. Our room had a full kitchen, with a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, etc. Also, they have a great breakfast each morning (it ends a little early on the weekend â€“ at 9:30 am.) The best thing about the property is the location. You are right in the middle of the Gaslamp district. We parked our car and didnâ€™t touch it for the entire time that we were there. Overall, a great experience, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel in Gaslight District”
Reviews.Author: scooterpie66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two different weekends and loved it. On arrival they saw we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and cheerfully upgraded us to a one bedroom suite on the 11th floor. The breakfast was scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, different breads, oatmeal, waffles, yogurt and fruit. The hotel does only offer valet parking (all hotels in area only offer paid parking) but since it is in the Gaslight district a car isn't totally necessary since public transportation is available. A taxi ride cost $11.80 plus tip from the airport, I do wish it had a shuttle service available to the airport. Many restaurants, pubs, and bars are within walking distance, we had dinner at the Old Spaghetti Factory. There is a CVS Pharmacy and a Borders bookstore and a liquor store called the The Wine Rack within a block of the hotel. We found the hotel very quiet, we stayed on the 11th floor the first time and the 8th floor on our second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Suitable for Busy or Stranded Business Traveler!!”
Reviews.Author: hayzeus29
Reviews.Content: Answers to the following requests: I requested a quite room, ability to wash, dry clothing and list of television channels when speaking over the telephone to front-desk supervisor and when meeting with her in person. The staff did not deliver. Morning of 20th of December and middle of the night 21st of December I informed front desk staff about the constant knocking and slamming of the door by the "guests" in the room next door only to have the hotel, or guests on their own, quite the rude and disruptive behavior by 0430. At 0430 on the 21st of December, I staggered to the door, after hearing knocking on a door, saw hotel staff knocking on another room door and asked why he was looking into the wrong guests. The Loss Prevention Manager stated that he was investigating the room from which marijuana smoke was emanating. "Don't you smell the pot," he asked." He soon realized that this crowd of adult men was bouncing from room to room with my "Suite" in the middle. You will probably have your room comp'ed, he explains. I told him that as a corporate traveler that is not a small comfort and does nothing for me. At eight AM on the 21st of December, I heard door knocking from a distance approach my room only to have housekeeping knock on my door and ask if I was checking out. When I asked if it was necessary or SOP for the hotel, she showed me a checklist of rooms and said it was. After explaining on the 20th of December that their bath soap is too harsh and stating that their hand soap is my preference, house keeping left me a tiny soap to shuttle between shower and vanity in the middle of the "suite." My room key expired on the 20th of December, a day before my departure, it took several calls by hotel staffer and one from myself to front desk before they were able to confirm I should be allowed into hotel room. After enquiring with front desk about the breakfast, I was sent to the second floor only to be told I missed it by half an hour. After asking for the newspaper, staff stated â€œthat pile of newspapers is what the guests have done with the papers. You can go through the pile if you'd like." When I asked for a complete newspaper I was told to see front desk. There was no one at front desk and, not unlike previous morning, there were no newspapers in the lobby. On the morning of the 21st of December, I asked for directions to Interstate 5 North through the maze of one-way streets only to receive a pretty pre-printed card which gets one to airport terminal via city streets and not Hancock Street, via Interstate 5 North, where I had a rental car to return. When attempting to wash and dry clothing I experienced the following, washing machines were sub-par and twice as expensive as at other Residence Inns. Dryer lint traps were full of lint, pulped paper and hair. I speculate that "guests" kept turning off the dryer as the laundry room is only three feet away from three guest "suites." I was not able to dry my sneakers before heading to the airport since guests did not allow dryer to run. After explaining to hotel staff that I did not have the list of channels they rushed a binder with list of channels that is not cross-referenced to a number, I could not determine if CNBC is channel 5, 8, 99 or 12. Bathroom vanity is in the middle of the suite and tissue paper hidden away on the bottom shelf where I noticed it when checking for my belongings before checkout. For a hotel that offers no shuttle to airport, it charges $35 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dizneguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Downtown/Gaslamp Quarter for a long weekend. The hotel had only been open a week when we arrived and everything was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly. The hotel provided a hot breakfast daily and has the only full service bar/restaurant in any Residence Inn. They also have a manager's reception although we didn't take advantage of it. It is in the hear of the Gaslamp Quarter not far from the convention center so there was quite a bit of activity within walking distance. One drawback of the hotel is that the only available parking is valet and is $32.00 per night. The do have a pool on the third floor roof but it holds 11 people and is 36" deep so don't plan on doing much more than standing in waist deep water. All-in-All, it was a nice hotel in a great location.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Downtown/Gaslamp Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 356 6th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
